content: 22 Don’t carry a burden out of your houses on the Sabbath day. Don’t do any work, but make the Sabbath day holy, as I commanded your fathers.

title: Jeremiah 17:23
content: 23 But they didn’t listen. They didn’t turn their ear, but made their neck stiff, that they might not hear, and might not receive instruction.

title: Jeremiah 17:24
content: 24 It will happen, if you diligently listen to me,” says the LORD, “to bring in no burden through the gates of this city on the Sabbath day, but to make the Sabbath day holy, to do no work therein;

title: Jeremiah 17:25
content: 25 then there will enter in by the gates of this city kings and princes sitting on David’s throne, riding in chariots and on horses, they and their princes, the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem; and this city will remain forever.

title: Jeremiah 17:26
content: 26 They will come from the cities of Judah, and from the places around Jerusalem, from the land of Benjamin, from the lowland, from the hill country, and from the South, bringing burnt offerings, sacrifices, meal offerings, and frankincense, and bringing sacrifices of thanksgiving to the LORD’s house.

title: Jeremiah 17:27
content: 27 But if you will not listen to me to make the Sabbath day holy, and not to bear a burden and enter in at the gates of Jerusalem on the Sabbath day, then I will kindle a fire in its gates, and it will devour the palaces of Jerusalem. It will not be quenched.”’”

title: Jeremiah 18:1
content: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,

title: Jeremiah 18:2
content: 2 “Arise, and go down to the potter’s house, and there I will cause you to hear my words.”

title: Jeremiah 18:3
content: 3 Then I went down to the potter’s house, and behold, he was making something on the wheels.

title: Jeremiah 18:4
content: 4 When the vessel that he made of the clay was marred in the hand of the potter, he made it again another vessel, as seemed good to the potter to make it.

title: Jeremiah 18:5
content: 5 Then the LORD’s word came to me, saying,

title: Jeremiah 18:6
content: 6 “House of Israel, can’t I do with you as this potter?” says the LORD. “Behold, as the clay in the potter’s hand, so are you in my hand, house of Israel.

title: Jeremiah 18:7
content: 7 At the instant I speak concerning a nation, and concerning a kingdom, to pluck up and to break down and to destroy it,

title: Jeremiah 18:8
content: 8 if that nation, concerning which I have spoken, turns from their evil, I will repent of the evil that I thought to do to them.

title: Jeremiah 18:9
content: 9 At the instant I speak concerning a nation, and concerning a kingdom, to build and to plant it,

title: Jeremiah 18:10
content: 10 if they do that which is evil in my sight, that they not obey my voice, then I will repent of the good with which I said I would benefit them.

title: Jeremiah 18:11
content: 11 “Now therefore, speak to the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying, ‘The LORD says: “Behold, I frame evil against you, and devise a plan against you. Everyone return from his evil way now, and amend your ways and your doings.”’

title: Jeremiah 18:12
content: 12 But they say, ‘It is in vain; for we will walk after our own plans, and we will each follow the stubbornness of his evil heart.’”

title: Jeremiah 18:13
content: 13 Therefore the LORD says: “Ask now among the nations, ‘Who has heard such things?’ The virgin of Israel has done a very horrible thing.

title: Jeremiah 18:14
content: 14 Will the snow of Lebanon fail from the rock of the field? Will the cold waters that flow down from afar be dried up?

title: Jeremiah 18:15
content: 15 For my people have forgotten me. They have burned incense to false gods. They have been made to stumble in their ways in the ancient paths, to walk in byways, in a way not built up,

title: Jeremiah 18:16
content: 16 to make their land an astonishment, and a perpetual hissing. Everyone who passes by it will be astonished, and shake his head.

title: Jeremiah 18:17
content: 17 I will scatter them as with an east wind before the enemy. I will show them the back, and not the face, in the day of their calamity.

title: Jeremiah 18:18
content: 18 Then they said, “Come! Let’s devise plans against Jeremiah; for the law won’t perish from the priest, nor counsel from the wise, nor the word from the prophet. Come, and let’s strike him with the tongue, and let’s not give heed to any of his words.”

title: Jeremiah 18:19
content: 19 Give heed to me, LORD, and listen to the voice of those who contend with me.

title: Jeremiah 18:20
content: 20 Should evil be recompensed for good? For they have dug a pit for my soul. Remember how I stood before you to speak good for them, to turn away your wrath from them.

title: Jeremiah 18:21
content: 21 Therefore deliver up their children to the famine, and give them over to the power of the sword. Let their wives become childless and widows. Let their men be killed and their young men struck by the sword in battle.

title: Jeremiah 18:22
content: 22 Let a cry be heard from their houses when you bring a troop suddenly on them; for they have dug a pit to take me and hidden snares for my feet.

title: Jeremiah 18:23
content: 23 Yet, LORD, you know all their counsel against me to kill me. Don’t forgive their iniquity. Don’t blot out their sin from your sight, Let them be overthrown before you. Deal with them in the time of your anger.

title: Jeremiah 19:1
content: 1 Thus said the LORD, “Go, and buy a potter’s earthen container, and take some of the elders of the people and of the elders of the priests;

title: Jeremiah 19:2
content: 2 and go out to the valley of the son of Hinnom, which is by the entry of the gate Harsith, and proclaim there the words that I will tell you.

title: Jeremiah 19:3
content: 3 Say, ‘Hear the LORD’s word, kings of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem: The LORD of Armies, the God of Israel says, “Behold, I will bring evil on this place, which whoever hears, his ears will tingle.

title: Jeremiah 19:4
content: 4 Because they have forsaken me, and have defiled this place, and have burned incense in it to other gods that they didn’t know—they, their fathers, and the kings of Judah—and have filled this place with the blood of innocents,

title: Jeremiah 19:5
content: 5 and have built the high places of Baal to burn their children in the fire for burnt offerings to Baal, which I didn’t command, nor speak, which didn’t even enter into my mind.

title: Jeremiah 19:6
content: 6 Therefore, behold, the days come,” says the LORD, “that this place will no more be called ‘Topheth’, nor ‘The Valley of the son of Hinnom’, but ‘The valley of Slaughter’.

title: Jeremiah 19:7
content: 7 “‘“I will make the counsel of Judah and Jerusalem void in this place. I will cause them to fall by the sword before their enemies, and by the hand of those who seek their life. I will give their dead bodies to be food for the birds of the sky and for the animals of the earth.

title: Jeremiah 19:8
content: 8 I will make this city an astonishment and a hissing. Everyone who passes by it will be astonished and hiss because of all its plagues.

title: Jeremiah 19:9
content: 9 I will cause them to eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters. They will each eat the flesh of his friend in the siege and in the distress with which their enemies, and those who seek their life, will distress them.”’

title: Jeremiah 19:10
content: 10 “Then you shall break the container in the sight of the men who go with you,

title: Jeremiah 19:11
content: 11 and shall tell them, ‘The LORD of Armies says: “Even so I will break this people and this city as one breaks a potter’s vessel, that can’t be made whole again. They will bury in Topheth until there is no place to bury.

title: Jeremiah 19:12
content: 12 This is what I will do to this place,” says the LORD, “and to its inhabitants, even making this city as Topheth.

title: Jeremiah 19:13
content: 13 The houses of Jerusalem and the houses of the kings of Judah, which are defiled, will be as the place of Topheth, even all the houses on whose roofs they have burned incense to all the army of the sky and have poured out drink offerings to other gods.”’”

title: Jeremiah 19:14
content: 14 Then Jeremiah came from Topheth, where the LORD had sent him to prophesy, and he stood in the court of the LORD’s house, and said to all the people:

title: Jeremiah 19:15
content: 15 “The LORD of Armies, the God of Israel says, ‘Behold, I will bring on this city and on all its towns all the evil that I have pronounced against it, because they have made their neck stiff, that they may not hear my words.’”

title: Jeremiah 20:1
content: 1 Now Pashhur, the son of Immer the priest, who was chief officer in the LORD’s house, heard Jeremiah prophesying these things.

title: Jeremiah 20:2
content: 2 Then Pashhur struck Jeremiah the prophet and put him in the stocks that were in the upper gate of Benjamin, which was in the LORD’s house.

title: Jeremiah 20:3
content: 3 On the next day, Pashhur released Jeremiah out of the stocks. Then Jeremiah said to him, “The LORD has not called your name Pashhur, but Magormissabib.

title: Jeremiah 20:4
content: 4 For the LORD says, ‘Behold, I will make you a terror to yourself and to all your friends. They will fall by the sword of their enemies, and your eyes will see it. I will give all Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will carry them captive to Babylon, and will kill them with the sword.

title: Jeremiah 20:5
content: 5 Moreover I will give all the riches of this city, and all its gains, and all its precious things, yes, I will give all the treasures of the kings of Judah into the hand of their enemies. They will make them captives, take them, and carry them to Babylon.

title: Jeremiah 20:6
content: 6 You, Pashhur, and all who dwell in your house will go into captivity. You will come to Babylon, and there you will die, and there you will be buried, you, and all your friends, to whom you have prophesied falsely.’”

title: Jeremiah 20:7
content: 7 LORD, you have persuaded me, and I was persuaded. You are stronger than I, and have prevailed. I have become a laughingstock all day. Everyone mocks me.

title: Jeremiah 20:8
content: 8 For as often as I speak, I cry out; I cry, “Violence and destruction!” because the LORD’s word has been made a reproach to me, and a derision, all day.

title: Jeremiah 20:9
content: 9 If I say that I will not make mention of him, or speak any more in his name, then there is in my heart as it were a burning fire shut up in my bones. I am weary with holding it in. I can’t.

title: Jeremiah 20:10
content: 10 For I have heard the defaming of many: “Terror on every side! Denounce, and we will denounce him!” say all my familiar friends, those who watch for my fall. “Perhaps he will be persuaded, and we will prevail against him, and we will take our revenge on him.”

title: Jeremiah 20:11
content: 11 But the LORD is with me as an awesome mighty one. Therefore my persecutors will stumble, and they won’t prevail. They will be utterly disappointed because they have not dealt wisely, even with an everlasting dishonor which will never be forgotten.

title: Jeremiah 20:12
content: 12 But the LORD of Armies, who tests the righteous, who sees the heart and the mind, let me see your vengeance on them, for I have revealed my cause to you.

title: Jeremiah 20:13
content: 13 Sing to the LORD! Praise the LORD, for he has delivered the soul of the needy from the hand of evildoers.

title: Jeremiah 20:14
content: 14 Cursed is the day in which I was born. Don’t let the day in which my mother bore me be blessed.

title: Jeremiah 20:15
content: 15 Cursed is the man who brought news to my father, saying, “A boy is born to you,” making him very glad.

title: Jeremiah 20:16
content: 16 Let that man be as the cities which the LORD overthrew, and didn’t repent. Let him hear a cry in the morning, and shouting at noontime,

title: Jeremiah 20:17
content: 17 because he didn’t kill me from the womb. So my mother would have been my grave, and her womb always great.

title: Jeremiah 20:18
content: 18 Why did I come out of the womb to see labor and sorrow, that my days should be consumed with shame?

title: Jeremiah 21:1
content: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD, when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur the son of Malchijah, and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, saying,

title: Jeremiah 21:2
content: 2 “Please inquire of the LORD for us; for Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon makes war against us. Perhaps the LORD will deal with us according to all his wondrous works, that he may withdraw from us.”

title: Jeremiah 21:3
content: 3 Then Jeremiah said to them, “Tell Zedekiah:

title: Jeremiah 21:4
content: 4 ‘The LORD, the God of Israel says, “Behold, I will turn back the weapons of war that are in your hands, with which you fight against the king of Babylon, and against the Chaldeans who besiege you outside the walls; and I will gather them into the middle of this city.

title: Jeremiah 21:5
content: 5 I myself will fight against you with an outstretched hand and with a strong arm, even in anger, in wrath, and in great indignation.

title: Jeremiah 21:6
content: 6 I will strike the inhabitants of this city, both man and animal. They will die of a great pestilence.

title: Jeremiah 21:7
content: 7 Afterward,” says the LORD, “I will deliver Zedekiah king of Judah, his servants, and the people, even those who are left in this city from the pestilence, from the sword, and from the famine, into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of those who seek their life. He will strike them with the edge of the sword. He will not spare them, have pity, or have mercy.”’

title: Jeremiah 21:8
content: 8 “You shall say to this people, ‘The LORD says: “Behold, I set before you the way of life and the way of death.

title: Jeremiah 21:9
content: 9 He who remains in this city will die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, but he who goes out and passes over to the Chaldeans who besiege you, he will live, and he will escape with his life.

title: Jeremiah 21:10
content: 10 For I have set my face on this city for evil, and not for good,” says the LORD. “It will be given into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will burn it with fire.”’

title: Jeremiah 21:11
content: 11 “Concerning the house of the king of Judah, hear the LORD’s word:

title: Jeremiah 21:12
content: 12 House of David, the LORD says, ‘Execute justice in the morning, and deliver him who is robbed out of the hand of the oppressor, lest my wrath go out like fire, and burn so that no one can quench it, because of the evil of your doings.

title: Jeremiah 21:13
content: 13 Behold, I am against you, O inhabitant of the valley, and of the rock of the plain,’ says the LORD. ‘You that say, “Who would come down against us?” or, “Who would enter into our homes?”

title: Jeremiah 21:14
content: 14 I will punish you according to the fruit of your doings,’ says the LORD; ‘and I will kindle a fire in her forest, and it will devour all that is around her.’”

title: Jeremiah 22:1
content: 1 The LORD said, “Go down to the house of the king of Judah, and speak this word there:

title: Jeremiah 22:2
content: 2 ‘Hear the LORD’s word, king of Judah, who sits on David’s throne—you, your servants, and your people who enter in by these gates.

title: Jeremiah 22:3
content: 3 The LORD says: “Execute justice and righteousness, and deliver him who is robbed out of the hand of the oppressor. Do no wrong. Do no violence to the foreigner, the fatherless, or the widow. Don’t shed innocent blood in this place.

title: Jeremiah 22:4
content: 4 For if you do this thing indeed, then kings sitting on David’s throne will enter in by the gates of this house, riding in chariots and on horses—they, their servants, and their people.

title: Jeremiah 22:5
content: 5 But if you will not hear these words, I swear by myself,” says the LORD, “that this house will become a desolation.”’”

title: Jeremiah 22:6
content: 6 For the LORD says concerning the house of the king of Judah: “You are Gilead to me, the head of Lebanon. Yet surely I will make you a wilderness, cities which are not inhabited.

title: Jeremiah 22:7
content: 7 I will prepare destroyers against you, everyone with his weapons, and they will cut down your choice cedars, and cast them into the fire.

title: Jeremiah 22:8
content: 8 “Many nations will pass by this city, and they will each ask his neighbor, ‘Why has the LORD done this to this great city?’

title: Jeremiah 22:9
content: 9 Then they will answer, ‘Because they abandoned the covenant of the LORD their God, worshiped other gods, and served them.’”

title: Jeremiah 22:10
content: 10 Don’t weep for the dead. Don’t bemoan him; but weep bitterly for him who goes away, for he will return no more, and not see his native country.

title: Jeremiah 22:11
content: 11 For the LORD says touching Shallum the son of Josiah, king of Judah, who reigned instead of Josiah his father, and who went out of this place: “He won’t return there any more.

title: Jeremiah 22:12
content: 12 But he will die in the place where they have led him captive. He will see this land no more.”

title: Jeremiah 22:13
content: 13 “Woe to him who builds his house by unrighteousness, and his rooms by injustice; who uses his neighbor’s service without wages, and doesn’t give him his hire;

title: Jeremiah 22:14
content: 14 who says, ‘I will build myself a wide house and spacious rooms,’ and cuts out windows for himself, with a cedar ceiling, and painted with red.

title: Jeremiah 22:15
content: 15 “Should you reign because you strive to excel in cedar? Didn’t your father eat and drink, and do justice and righteousness? Then it was well with him.

title: Jeremiah 22:16
content: 16 He judged the cause of the poor and needy; so then it was well. Wasn’t this to know me?” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 22:17
content: 17 But your eyes and your heart are only for your covetousness, for shedding innocent blood, for oppression, and for doing violence.”

title: Jeremiah 22:18
content: 18 Therefore the LORD says concerning Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah: “They won’t lament for him, saying, ‘Ah my brother!’ or, ‘Ah sister!’ They won’t lament for him, saying ‘Ah lord!’ or, ‘Ah his glory!’

title: Jeremiah 22:19
content: 19 He will be buried with the burial of a donkey, drawn and cast out beyond the gates of Jerusalem.”

title: Jeremiah 22:20
content: 20 “Go up to Lebanon, and cry out. Lift up your voice in Bashan, and cry from Abarim; for all your lovers have been destroyed.

title: Jeremiah 22:21
content: 21 I spoke to you in your prosperity, but you said, ‘I will not listen.’ This has been your way from your youth, that you didn’t obey my voice.

title: Jeremiah 22:22
content: 22 The wind will feed all your shepherds, and your lovers will go into captivity. Surely then you will be ashamed and confounded for all your wickedness.

title: Jeremiah 22:23
content: 23 Inhabitant of Lebanon, who makes your nest in the cedars, how greatly to be pitied you will be when pangs come on you, the pain as of a woman in travail!

title: Jeremiah 22:24
content: 24 “As I live,” says the LORD, “though Coniah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah were the signet on my right hand, I would still pluck you from there.

title: Jeremiah 22:25
content: 25 I would give you into the hand of those who seek your life, and into the hand of them of whom you are afraid, even into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of the Chaldeans.

title: Jeremiah 22:26
content: 26 I will cast you out with your mother who bore you into another country, where you were not born; and there you will die.

title: Jeremiah 22:27
content: 27 But to the land to which their soul longs to return, there they will not return.”

title: Jeremiah 22:28
content: 28 Is this man Coniah a despised broken vessel? Is he a vessel in which no one delights? Why are they cast out, he and his offspring, and cast into a land which they don’t know?

title: Jeremiah 22:29
content: 29 O earth, earth, earth, hear the LORD’s word!

title: Jeremiah 22:30
content: 30 The LORD says, “Record this man as childless, a man who will not prosper in his days; for no more will a man of his offspring prosper, sitting on David’s throne and ruling in Judah.”

title: Jeremiah 23:1
content: 1 “Woe to the shepherds who destroy and scatter the sheep of my pasture!” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 23:2
content: 2 Therefore the LORD, the God of Israel, says against the shepherds who feed my people: “You have scattered my flock, driven them away, and have not visited them. Behold, I will visit on you the evil of your doings,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 23:3
content: 3 “I will gather the remnant of my flock out of all the countries where I have driven them, and will bring them again to their folds; and they will be fruitful and multiply.

title: Jeremiah 23:4
content: 4 I will set up shepherds over them who will feed them. They will no longer be afraid or dismayed, neither will any be lacking,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 23:5
content: 5 “Behold, the days come,” says the LORD, “that I will raise to David a righteous Branch; and he will reign as king and deal wisely, and will execute justice and righteousness in the land.

title: Jeremiah 23:6
content: 6 In his days Judah will be saved, and Israel will dwell safely. This is his name by which he will be called: The LORD our righteousness.

title: Jeremiah 23:7
content: 7 “Therefore, behold, the days come,” says the LORD, “that they will no more say, ‘As the LORD lives, who brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;’

title: Jeremiah 23:8
content: 8 but, ‘As the LORD lives, who brought up and who led the offspring of the house of Israel out of the north country, and from all the countries where I had driven them.’ Then they will dwell in their own land.”

title: Jeremiah 23:9
content: 9 Concerning the prophets: My heart within me is broken. All my bones shake. I am like a drunken man, and like a man whom wine has overcome, because of the LORD, and because of his holy words.

title: Jeremiah 23:10
content: 10 “For the land is full of adulterers; for because of the curse the land mourns. The pastures of the wilderness have dried up. Their course is evil, and their might is not right;

title: Jeremiah 23:11
content: 11 for both prophet and priest are profane. Yes, in my house I have found their wickedness,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 23:12
content: 12 Therefore their way will be to them as slippery places in the darkness. They will be driven on, and fall therein; for I will bring evil on them, even the year of their visitation,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 23:13
content: 13 “I have seen folly in the prophets of Samaria. They prophesied by Baal, and caused my people Israel to err.

title: Jeremiah 23:14
content: 14 In the prophets of Jerusalem I have also seen a horrible thing: they commit adultery and walk in lies. They strengthen the hands of evildoers, so that no one returns from his wickedness. They have all become to me as Sodom, and its inhabitants as Gomorrah.”

title: Jeremiah 23:15
content: 15 Therefore the LORD of Armies says concerning the prophets: “Behold, I will feed them with wormwood, and make them drink poisoned water; for from the prophets of Jerusalem ungodliness has gone out into all the land.”

title: Jeremiah 23:16
content: 16 The LORD of Armies says, “Don’t listen to the words of the prophets who prophesy to you. They teach you vanity. They speak a vision of their own heart, and not out of the mouth of the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 23:17
content: 17 They say continually to those who despise me, ‘The LORD has said, “You will have peace;”’ and to everyone who walks in the stubbornness of his own heart they say, ‘No evil will come on you.’

title: Jeremiah 23:18
content: 18 For who has stood in the council of the LORD, that he should perceive and hear his word? Who has listened to my word, and heard it?

title: Jeremiah 23:19
content: 19 Behold, the LORD’s storm, his wrath, has gone out. Yes, a whirling storm! It will burst on the head of the wicked.

title: Jeremiah 23:20
content: 20 The LORD’s anger will not return until he has executed and performed the intents of his heart. In the latter days, you will understand it perfectly.

title: Jeremiah 23:21
content: 21 I didn’t send these prophets, yet they ran. I didn’t speak to them, yet they prophesied.

title: Jeremiah 23:22
content: 22 But if they had stood in my council, then they would have caused my people to hear my words, and would have turned them from their evil way, and from the evil of their doings.

title: Jeremiah 23:23
content: 23 “Am I a God at hand,” says the LORD, “and not a God afar off?

title: Jeremiah 23:24
content: 24 Can anyone hide himself in secret places so that I can’t see him?” says the LORD. “Don’t I fill heaven and earth?” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 23:25
content: 25 “I have heard what the prophets have said, who prophesy lies in my name, saying, ‘I had a dream! I had a dream!’

title: Jeremiah 23:26
content: 26 How long will this be in the heart of the prophets who prophesy lies, even the prophets of the deceit of their own heart?

title: Jeremiah 23:27
content: 27 They intend to cause my people to forget my name by their dreams which they each tell his neighbor, as their fathers forgot my name because of Baal.

title: Jeremiah 23:28
content: 28 The prophet who has a dream, let him tell a dream; and he who has my word, let him speak my word faithfully. What is the straw to the wheat?” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 23:29
content: 29 “Isn’t my word like fire?” says the LORD; “and like a hammer that breaks the rock in pieces?

title: Jeremiah 23:30
content: 30 “Therefore behold, I am against the prophets,” says the LORD, “who each steal my words from his neighbor.

title: Jeremiah 23:31
content: 31 Behold, I am against the prophets,” says the LORD, “who use their tongues, and say, ‘He says.’

title: Jeremiah 23:32
content: 32 Behold, I am against those who prophesy lying dreams,” says the LORD, “who tell them, and cause my people to err by their lies, and by their vain boasting; yet I didn’t send them or command them. They don’t profit this people at all,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 23:33
content: 33 “When this people, or the prophet, or a priest, asks you, saying, ‘What is the message from the LORD?’ Then you shall tell them, ‘“What message? I will cast you off,” says the LORD.’

title: Jeremiah 23:34
content: 34 As for the prophet, the priest, and the people, who say, ‘The message from the LORD,’ I will even punish that man and his household.

title: Jeremiah 23:35
content: 35 You will say everyone to his neighbor, and everyone to his brother, ‘What has the LORD answered?’ and, ‘What has the LORD said?’

title: Jeremiah 23:36
content: 36 You will mention the message from the LORD no more, for every man’s own word has become his message; for you have perverted the words of the living God, of the LORD of Armies, our God.

title: Jeremiah 23:37
content: 37 You will say to the prophet, ‘What has the LORD answered you?’ and, ‘What has the LORD spoken?’

title: Jeremiah 23:38
content: 38 Although you say, ‘The message from the LORD,’ therefore the LORD says: ‘Because you say this word, “The message from the LORD,” and I have sent to you, telling you not to say, “The message from the LORD,”

title: Jeremiah 23:39
content: 39 therefore behold, I will utterly forget you, and I will cast you off with the city that I gave to you and to your fathers, away from my presence.

title: Jeremiah 23:40
content: 40 I will bring an everlasting reproach on you, and a perpetual shame, which will not be forgotten.’”

title: Jeremiah 24:1
content: 1 The LORD showed me, and behold, two baskets of figs were set before the LORD’s temple, after Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and the princes of Judah, with the craftsmen and smiths, from Jerusalem, and had brought them to Babylon.

title: Jeremiah 24:2
content: 2 One basket had very good figs, like the figs that are first-ripe; and the other basket had very bad figs, which could not be eaten, they were so bad.

title: Jeremiah 24:3
content: 3 Then the LORD asked me, “What do you see, Jeremiah?” I said, “Figs. The good figs are very good, and the bad are very bad, so bad that they can’t be eaten.”

title: Jeremiah 24:4
content: 4 The LORD’s word came to me, saying,

title: Jeremiah 24:5
content: 5 “The LORD, the God of Israel says: ‘Like these good figs, so I will regard the captives of Judah, whom I have sent out of this place into the land of the Chaldeans, as good.

title: Jeremiah 24:6
content: 6 For I will set my eyes on them for good, and I will bring them again to this land. I will build them, and not pull them down. I will plant them, and not pluck them up.

title: Jeremiah 24:7
content: 7 I will give them a heart to know me, that I am the LORD. They will be my people, and I will be their God; for they will return to me with their whole heart.

title: Jeremiah 24:8
content: 8 “‘As the bad figs, which can’t be eaten, they are so bad,’ surely the LORD says, ‘So I will give up Zedekiah the king of Judah, and his princes, and the remnant of Jerusalem who remain in this land, and those who dwell in the land of Egypt.

title: Jeremiah 24:9
content: 9 I will even give them up to be tossed back and forth among all the kingdoms of the earth for evil, to be a reproach and a proverb, a taunt and a curse, in all places where I will drive them.

title: Jeremiah 24:10
content: 10 I will send the sword, the famine, and the pestilence among them, until they are consumed from off the land that I gave to them and to their fathers.’”

title: Jeremiah 25:1
content: 1 The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah (this was the first year of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon),

title: Jeremiah 25:2
content: 2 which Jeremiah the prophet spoke to all the people of Judah, and to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem:

title: Jeremiah 25:3
content: 3 From the thirteenth year of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah, even to this day, these twenty-three years, the LORD’s word has come to me, and I have spoken to you, rising up early and speaking; but you have not listened.

title: Jeremiah 25:4
content: 4 The LORD has sent to you all his servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them (but you have not listened or inclined your ear to hear),

title: Jeremiah 25:5
content: 5 saying, “Return now everyone from his evil way, and from the evil of your doings, and dwell in the land that the LORD has given to you and to your fathers, from of old and even forever more.

title: Jeremiah 25:6
content: 6 Don’t go after other gods to serve them or worship them, and don’t provoke me to anger with the work of your hands; then I will do you no harm.”

title: Jeremiah 25:7
content: 7 “Yet you have not listened to me,” says the LORD, “that you may provoke me to anger with the work of your hands to your own hurt.”

title: Jeremiah 25:8
content: 8 Therefore the LORD of Armies says: “Because you have not heard my words,

title: Jeremiah 25:9
content: 9 behold, I will send and take all the families of the north,” says the LORD, “and I will send to Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, my servant, and will bring them against this land, and against its inhabitants, and against all these nations around. I will utterly destroy them, and make them an astonishment, and a hissing, and perpetual desolations.

title: Jeremiah 25:10
content: 10 Moreover I will take from them the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the sound of the millstones, and the light of the lamp.

title: Jeremiah 25:11
content: 11 This whole land will be a desolation, and an astonishment; and these nations will serve the king of Babylon seventy years.

title: Jeremiah 25:12
content: 12 “It will happen, when seventy years are accomplished, that I will punish the king of Babylon and that nation,” says the LORD, “for their iniquity. I will make the land of the Chaldeans desolate forever.

title: Jeremiah 25:13
content: 13 I will bring on that land all my words which I have pronounced against it, even all that is written in this book, which Jeremiah has prophesied against all the nations.

title: Jeremiah 25:14
content: 14 For many nations and great kings will make bondservants of them, even of them. I will recompense them according to their deeds, and according to the work of their hands.”

title: Jeremiah 25:15
content: 15 For the LORD, the God of Israel, says to me: “Take this cup of the wine of wrath from my hand, and cause all the nations to whom I send you to drink it.

title: Jeremiah 25:16
content: 16 They will drink, and reel back and forth, and be insane, because of the sword that I will send among them.”

title: Jeremiah 25:17
content: 17 Then I took the cup at the LORD’s hand, and made all the nations to drink, to whom the LORD had sent me:

title: Jeremiah 25:18
content: 18 Jerusalem, and the cities of Judah, with its kings and its princes, to make them a desolation, an astonishment, a hissing, and a curse, as it is today;

title: Jeremiah 25:19
content: 19 Pharaoh king of Egypt, with his servants, his princes, and all his people;

title: Jeremiah 25:20
content: 20 and all the mixed people, and all the kings of the land of Uz, all the kings of the Philistines, Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron, and the remnant of Ashdod;

title: Jeremiah 25:21
content: 21 Edom, Moab, and the children of Ammon;

title: Jeremiah 25:22
content: 22 and all the kings of Tyre, all the kings of Sidon, and the kings of the isle which is beyond the sea;

title: Jeremiah 25:23
content: 23 Dedan, Tema, Buz, and all who have the corners of their beard cut off;

title: Jeremiah 25:24
content: 24 and all the kings of Arabia, all the kings of the mixed people who dwell in the wilderness;

title: Jeremiah 25:25
content: 25 and all the kings of Zimri, all the kings of Elam, and all the kings of the Medes;

title: Jeremiah 25:26
content: 26 and all the kings of the north, far and near, one with another; and all the kingdoms of the world, which are on the surface of the earth. The king of Sheshach will drink after them.

title: Jeremiah 25:27
content: 27 “You shall tell them, ‘The LORD of Armies, the God of Israel says: “Drink, and be drunk, vomit, fall, and rise no more, because of the sword which I will send among you.”’

title: Jeremiah 25:28
content: 28 It shall be, if they refuse to take the cup at your hand to drink, then you shall tell them, ‘The LORD of Armies says: “You shall surely drink.

title: Jeremiah 25:29
content: 29 For, behold, I begin to work evil at the city which is called by my name; and should you be utterly unpunished? You will not be unpunished; for I will call for a sword on all the inhabitants of the earth, says the LORD of Armies.”’

title: Jeremiah 25:30
content: 30 “Therefore prophesy against them all these words, and tell them, “‘The LORD will roar from on high, and utter his voice from his holy habitation. He will mightily roar against his fold. He will give a shout, as those who tread grapes, against all the inhabitants of the earth.

title: Jeremiah 25:31
content: 31 A noise will come even to the end of the earth; for the LORD has a controversy with the nations. He will enter into judgment with all flesh. As for the wicked, he will give them to the sword,”’ says the LORD.”

title: Jeremiah 25:32
content: 32 The LORD of Armies says, “Behold, evil will go out from nation to nation, and a great storm will be raised up from the uttermost parts of the earth.”

title: Jeremiah 25:33
content: 33 The slain of the LORD will be at that day from one end of the earth even to the other end of the earth. They won’t be lamented. They won’t be gathered or buried. They will be dung on the surface of the ground.

title: Jeremiah 25:34
content: 34 Wail, you shepherds, and cry. Wallow in dust, you leader of the flock; for the days of your slaughter and of your dispersions have fully come, and you will fall like fine pottery.

title: Jeremiah 25:35
content: 35 The shepherds will have no way to flee. The leader of the flock will have no escape.

title: Jeremiah 25:36
content: 36 A voice of the cry of the shepherds, and the wailing of the leader of the flock, for the LORD destroys their pasture.

title: Jeremiah 25:37
content: 37 The peaceful folds are brought to silence because of the fierce anger of the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 25:38
content: 38 He has left his covert, as the lion; for their land has become an astonishment because of the fierceness of the oppression, and because of his fierce anger.

title: Jeremiah 26:1
content: 1 In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came from the LORD:

title: Jeremiah 26:2
content: 2 “The LORD says: ‘Stand in the court of the LORD’s house, and speak to all the cities of Judah which come to worship in the LORD’s house, all the words that I command you to speak to them. Don’t omit a word.

title: Jeremiah 26:3
content: 3 It may be they will listen, and every man turn from his evil way, that I may relent from the evil which I intend to do to them because of the evil of their doings.’”

title: Jeremiah 26:4
content: 4 You shall tell them, “The LORD says: ‘If you will not listen to me, to walk in my law which I have set before you,

title: Jeremiah 26:5
content: 5 to listen to the words of my servants the prophets whom I send to you, even rising up early and sending them—but you have not listened—

title: Jeremiah 26:6
content: 6 then I will make this house like Shiloh, and will make this city a curse to all the nations of the earth.’”

title: Jeremiah 26:7
content: 7 The priests and the prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the LORD’s house.

title: Jeremiah 26:8
content: 8 When Jeremiah had finished speaking all that the LORD had commanded him to speak to all the people, the priests and the prophets and all the people seized him, saying, “You shall surely die!

title: Jeremiah 26:9
content: 9 Why have you prophesied in the LORD’s name, saying, ‘This house will be like Shiloh, and this city will be desolate, without inhabitant’?” All the people were crowded around Jeremiah in the LORD’s house.

title: Jeremiah 26:10
content: 10 When the princes of Judah heard these things, they came up from the king’s house to the LORD’s house; and they sat in the entry of the new gate of the LORD’s house.

title: Jeremiah 26:11
content: 11 Then the priests and the prophets spoke to the princes and to all the people, saying, “This man is worthy of death, for he has prophesied against this city, as you have heard with your ears.”

title: Jeremiah 26:12
content: 12 Then Jeremiah spoke to all the princes and to all the people, saying, “The LORD sent me to prophesy against this house and against this city all the words that you have heard.

title: Jeremiah 26:13
content: 13 Now therefore amend your ways and your doings, and obey the LORD your God’s voice; then the LORD will relent from the evil that he has pronounced against you.

title: Jeremiah 26:14
content: 14 But as for me, behold, I am in your hand. Do with me what is good and right in your eyes.

title: Jeremiah 26:15
content: 15 Only know for certain that if you put me to death, you will bring innocent blood on yourselves, on this city, and on its inhabitants; for in truth the LORD has sent me to you to speak all these words in your ears.”

title: Jeremiah 26:16
content: 16 Then the princes and all the people said to the priests and to the prophets: “This man is not worthy of death; for he has spoken to us in the name of the LORD our God.”

title: Jeremiah 26:17
content: 17 Then certain of the elders of the land rose up, and spoke to all the assembly of the people, saying,

title: Jeremiah 26:18
content: 18 “Micah the Morashtite prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah; and he spoke to all the people of Judah, saying, ‘The LORD of Armies says: “‘Zion will be plowed as a field, and Jerusalem will become heaps, and the mountain of the house as the high places of a forest.’

title: Jeremiah 26:19
content: 19 Did Hezekiah king of Judah and all Judah put him to death? Didn’t he fear the LORD, and entreat the favor of the LORD, and the LORD relented of the disaster which he had pronounced against them? We would commit great evil against our own souls that way!”

title: Jeremiah 26:20
content: 20 There was also a man who prophesied in the LORD’s name, Uriah the son of Shemaiah of Kiriath Jearim; and he prophesied against this city and against this land according to all the words of Jeremiah.

title: Jeremiah 26:21
content: 21 When Jehoiakim the king, with all his mighty men and all the princes heard his words, the king sought to put him to death; but when Uriah heard it, he was afraid, and fled, and went into Egypt.

title: Jeremiah 26:22
content: 22 Then Jehoiakim the king sent Elnathan the son of Achbor and certain men with him into Egypt.

title: Jeremiah 26:23
content: 23 They fetched Uriah out of Egypt and brought him to Jehoiakim the king, who killed him with the sword and cast his dead body into the graves of the common people.

title: Jeremiah 26:24
content: 24 But the hand of Ahikam the son of Shaphan was with Jeremiah, so that they didn’t give him into the hand of the people to put him to death.

title: Jeremiah 27:1
content: 1 In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,

title: Jeremiah 27:2
content: 2 the LORD says to me: “Make bonds and bars, and put them on your neck.

title: Jeremiah 27:3
content: 3 Then send them to the king of Edom, to the king of Moab, to the king of the children of Ammon, to the king of Tyre, and to the king of Sidon, by the hand of the messengers who come to Jerusalem to Zedekiah king of Judah.

title: Jeremiah 27:4
content: 4 Give them a command to their masters, saying, ‘The LORD of Armies, the God of Israel says, “You shall tell your masters:

title: Jeremiah 27:5
content: 5 ‘I have made the earth, the men, and the animals that are on the surface of the earth by my great power and by my outstretched arm. I give it to whom it seems right to me.

title: Jeremiah 27:6
content: 6 Now I have given all these lands into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, my servant. I have also given the animals of the field to him to serve him.

title: Jeremiah 27:7
content: 7 All the nations will serve him, his son, and his son’s son, until the time of his own land comes. Then many nations and great kings will make him their bondservant.

title: Jeremiah 27:8
content: 8 “‘“‘It will happen that I will punish the nation and the kingdom which will not serve the same Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and that will not put their neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon,’ says the LORD, ‘with the sword, with famine, and with pestilence, until I have consumed them by his hand.

title: Jeremiah 27:9
content: 9 But as for you, don’t listen to your prophets, to your diviners, to your dreams, to your soothsayers, or to your sorcerers, who speak to you, saying, “You shall not serve the king of Babylon;”

title: Jeremiah 27:10
content: 10 for they prophesy a lie to you, to remove you far from your land, so that I would drive you out, and you would perish.

title: Jeremiah 27:11
content: 11 But the nation that brings their neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon and serves him, that nation I will let remain in their own land,’ says the LORD; ‘and they will till it and dwell in it.’”’”

title: Jeremiah 27:12
content: 12 I spoke to Zedekiah king of Judah according to all these words, saying, “Bring your necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon, and serve him and his people, and live.

title: Jeremiah 27:13
content: 13 Why will you die, you and your people, by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, as the LORD has spoken concerning the nation that will not serve the king of Babylon?

title: Jeremiah 27:14
content: 14 Don’t listen to the words of the prophets who speak to you, saying, ‘You shall not serve the king of Babylon;’ for they prophesy a lie to you.

title: Jeremiah 27:15
content: 15 For I have not sent them,” says the LORD, “but they prophesy falsely in my name; that I may drive you out, and that you may perish, you, and the prophets who prophesy to you.”

title: Jeremiah 27:16
content: 16 Also I spoke to the priests and to all this people, saying, the LORD says, “Don’t listen to the words of your prophets who prophesy to you, saying, ‘Behold, the vessels of the LORD’s house will now shortly be brought again from Babylon;’ for they prophesy a lie to you.

title: Jeremiah 27:17
content: 17 Don’t listen to them. Serve the king of Babylon, and live. Why should this city become a desolation?

title: Jeremiah 27:18
content: 18 But if they are prophets, and if the LORD’s word is with them, let them now make intercession to the LORD of Armies, that the vessels which are left in the LORD’s house, in the house of the king of Judah, and at Jerusalem, don’t go to Babylon.

title: Jeremiah 27:19
content: 19 For the LORD of Armies says concerning the pillars, concerning the sea, concerning the bases, and concerning the rest of the vessels that are left in this city,

title: Jeremiah 27:20
content: 20 which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon didn’t take when he carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, from Jerusalem to Babylon, and all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem—

title: Jeremiah 27:21
content: 21 yes, the LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says concerning the vessels that are left in the LORD’s house, and in the house of the king of Judah, and at Jerusalem:

title: Jeremiah 27:22
content: 22 ‘They will be carried to Babylon, and there they will be, until the day that I visit them,’ says the LORD; ‘then I will bring them up, and restore them to this place.’”

title: Jeremiah 28:1
content: 1 That same year, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the fourth year, in the fifth month, Hananiah the son of Azzur, the prophet, who was of Gibeon, spoke to me in the LORD’s house, in the presence of the priests and of all the people, saying,

title: Jeremiah 28:2
content: 2 “The LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says, ‘I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.

title: Jeremiah 28:3
content: 3 Within two full years I will bring again into this place all the vessels of the LORD’s house that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took away from this place and carried to Babylon.

title: Jeremiah 28:4
content: 4 I will bring again to this place Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, with all the captives of Judah, who went to Babylon,’ says the LORD; ‘for I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.’”

title: Jeremiah 28:5
content: 5 Then the prophet Jeremiah said to the prophet Hananiah in the presence of the priests, and in the presence of all the people who stood in the LORD’s house,

title: Jeremiah 28:6
content: 6 even the prophet Jeremiah said, “Amen! May the LORD do so. May the LORD perform your words which you have prophesied, to bring again the vessels of the LORD’s house, and all those who are captives, from Babylon to this place.

title: Jeremiah 28:7
content: 7 Nevertheless listen now to this word that I speak in your ears, and in the ears of all the people:

title: Jeremiah 28:8
content: 8 The prophets who have been before me and before you of old prophesied against many countries, and against great kingdoms, of war, of evil, and of pestilence.

title: Jeremiah 28:9
content: 9 As for the prophet who prophesies of peace, when the word of the prophet happens, then the prophet will be known, that the LORD has truly sent him.”

title: Jeremiah 28:10
content: 10 Then Hananiah the prophet took the bar from off the prophet Jeremiah’s neck, and broke it.

title: Jeremiah 28:11
content: 11 Hananiah spoke in the presence of all the people, saying, “The LORD says: ‘Even so I will break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon from off the neck of all the nations within two full years.’” Then the prophet Jeremiah went his way.

title: Jeremiah 28:12
content: 12 Then the LORD’s word came to Jeremiah, after Hananiah the prophet had broken the bar from off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, saying,

title: Jeremiah 28:13
content: 13 “Go, and tell Hananiah, saying, ‘The LORD says, “You have broken the bars of wood, but you have made in their place bars of iron.”

title: Jeremiah 28:14
content: 14 For the LORD of Armies, the God of Israel says, “I have put a yoke of iron on the neck of all these nations, that they may serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; and they will serve him. I have also given him the animals of the field.”’”

title: Jeremiah 28:15
content: 15 Then the prophet Jeremiah said to Hananiah the prophet, “Listen, Hananiah! The LORD has not sent you, but you make this people trust in a lie.

title: Jeremiah 28:16
content: 16 Therefore the LORD says, ‘Behold, I will send you away from off the surface of the earth. This year you will die, because you have spoken rebellion against the LORD.’”

title: Jeremiah 28:17
content: 17 So Hananiah the prophet died the same year in the seventh month.

title: Jeremiah 29:1
content: 1 Now these are the words of the letter that Jeremiah the prophet sent from Jerusalem to the residue of the elders of the captivity, and to the priests, to the prophets, and to all the people whom Nebuchadnezzar had carried away captive from Jerusalem to Babylon,

title: Jeremiah 29:2
content: 2 (after Jeconiah the king, the queen mother, the eunuchs, the princes of Judah and Jerusalem, the craftsmen, and the smiths had departed from Jerusalem),

title: Jeremiah 29:3
content: 3 by the hand of Elasah the son of Shaphan and Gemariah the son of Hilkiah, (whom Zedekiah king of Judah sent to Babylon to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon). It said:

title: Jeremiah 29:4
content: 4 The LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says to all the captives whom I have caused to be carried away captive from Jerusalem to Babylon:

title: Jeremiah 29:5
content: 5 “Build houses and dwell in them. Plant gardens and eat their fruit.

title: Jeremiah 29:6
content: 6 Take wives and father sons and daughters. Take wives for your sons, and give your daughters to husbands, that they may bear sons and daughters. Multiply there, and don’t be diminished.

title: Jeremiah 29:7
content: 7 Seek the peace of the city where I have caused you to be carried away captive, and pray to the LORD for it; for in its peace you will have peace.”

title: Jeremiah 29:8
content: 8 For the LORD of Armies, the God of Israel says: “Don’t let your prophets who are among you and your diviners deceive you. Don’t listen to your dreams which you cause to be dreamed.

title: Jeremiah 29:9
content: 9 For they prophesy falsely to you in my name. I have not sent them,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 29:10
content: 10 For the LORD says, “After seventy years are accomplished for Babylon, I will visit you and perform my good word toward you, in causing you to return to this place.

title: Jeremiah 29:11
content: 11 For I know the thoughts that I think toward you,” says the LORD, “thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you hope and a future.

title: Jeremiah 29:12
content: 12 You shall call on me, and you shall go and pray to me, and I will listen to you.

title: Jeremiah 29:13
content: 13 You shall seek me and find me, when you search for me with all your heart.

title: Jeremiah 29:14
content: 14 I will be found by you,” says the LORD, “and I will turn again your captivity, and I will gather you from all the nations, and from all the places where I have driven you,” says the LORD. “I will bring you again to the place from where I caused you to be carried away captive.”

title: Jeremiah 29:15
content: 15 Because you have said, “The LORD has raised us up prophets in Babylon,”

title: Jeremiah 29:16
content: 16 the LORD says concerning the king who sits on David’s throne, and concerning all the people who dwell in this city, your brothers who haven’t gone with you into captivity,

title: Jeremiah 29:17
content: 17 the LORD of Armies says: “Behold, I will send on them the sword, the famine, and the pestilence, and will make them like rotten figs that can’t be eaten, they are so bad.

title: Jeremiah 29:18
content: 18 I will pursue after them with the sword, with the famine, and with the pestilence, and will deliver them to be tossed back and forth among all the kingdoms of the earth, to be an object of horror, an astonishment, a hissing, and a reproach among all the nations where I have driven them,

title: Jeremiah 29:19
content: 19 because they have not listened to my words,” says the LORD, “with which I sent to them my servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them; but you would not hear,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 29:20
content: 20 Hear therefore the LORD’s word, all you captives whom I have sent away from Jerusalem to Babylon.

title: Jeremiah 29:21
content: 21 The LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says concerning Ahab the son of Kolaiah, and concerning Zedekiah the son of Maaseiah, who prophesy a lie to you in my name: “Behold, I will deliver them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; and he will kill them before your eyes.

title: Jeremiah 29:22
content: 22 A curse will be taken up about them by all the captives of Judah who are in Babylon, saying, ‘The LORD make you like Zedekiah and like Ahab, whom the king of Babylon roasted in the fire;’

title: Jeremiah 29:23
content: 23 because they have done foolish things in Israel, and have committed adultery with their neighbors’ wives, and have spoken words in my name falsely, which I didn’t command them. I am he who knows, and am witness,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 29:24
content: 24 Concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite you shall speak, saying,

title: Jeremiah 29:25
content: 25 “The LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says, ‘Because you have sent letters in your own name to all the people who are at Jerusalem, and to Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, and to all the priests, saying,

title: Jeremiah 29:26
content: 26 “The LORD has made you priest in the place of Jehoiada the priest, that there may be officers in the LORD’s house, for every man who is crazy and makes himself a prophet, that you should put him in the stocks and in shackles.

title: Jeremiah 29:27
content: 27 Now therefore, why have you not rebuked Jeremiah of Anathoth, who makes himself a prophet to you,

title: Jeremiah 29:28
content: 28 because he has sent to us in Babylon, saying, The captivity is long. Build houses, and dwell in them. Plant gardens, and eat their fruit?”’”

title: Jeremiah 29:29
content: 29 Zephaniah the priest read this letter in the hearing of Jeremiah the prophet.

title: Jeremiah 29:30
content: 30 Then the LORD’s word came to Jeremiah, saying,

title: Jeremiah 29:31
content: 31 “Send to all of the captives, saying, ‘The LORD says concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite: “Because Shemaiah has prophesied to you, and I didn’t send him, and he has caused you to trust in a lie,”

title: Jeremiah 29:32
content: 32 therefore the LORD says, “Behold, I will punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite and his offspring. He will not have a man to dwell among this people. He won’t see the good that I will do to my people,” says the LORD, “because he has spoken rebellion against the LORD.”’”

title: Jeremiah 30:1
content: 1 The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,

title: Jeremiah 30:2
content: 2 “The LORD, the God of Israel, says, ‘Write all the words that I have spoken to you in a book.

title: Jeremiah 30:3
content: 3 For, behold, the days come,’ says the LORD, ‘that I will reverse the captivity of my people Israel and Judah,’ says the LORD. ‘I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they will possess it.’”

title: Jeremiah 30:4
content: 4 These are the words that the LORD spoke concerning Israel and concerning Judah.

title: Jeremiah 30:5
content: 5 For the LORD says: “We have heard a voice of trembling; a voice of fear, and not of peace.

title: Jeremiah 30:6
content: 6 Ask now, and see whether a man travails with child. Why do I see every man with his hands on his waist, as a woman in travail, and all faces are turned pale?

title: Jeremiah 30:7
content: 7 Alas, for that day is great, so that none is like it! It is even the time of Jacob’s trouble; but he will be saved out of it.

title: Jeremiah 30:8
content: 8 It will come to pass in that day, says the LORD of Armies, that I will break his yoke from off your neck, and will burst your bonds. Strangers will no more make them their bondservants;

title: Jeremiah 30:9
content: 9 but they will serve the LORD their God, and David their king, whom I will raise up to them.

title: Jeremiah 30:10
content: 10 Therefore don’t be afraid, O Jacob my servant, says the LORD. Don’t be dismayed, Israel. For, behold, I will save you from afar, and save your offspring from the land of their captivity. Jacob will return, and will be quiet and at ease. No one will make him afraid.

title: Jeremiah 30:11
content: 11 For I am with you, says the LORD, to save you; for I will make a full end of all the nations where I have scattered you, but I will not make a full end of you; but I will correct you in measure, and will in no way leave you unpunished.”

title: Jeremiah 30:12
content: 12 For the LORD says, “Your hurt is incurable. Your wound is grievous.

title: Jeremiah 30:13
content: 13 There is no one to plead your cause, that you may be bound up. You have no healing medicines.

title: Jeremiah 30:14
content: 14 All your lovers have forgotten you. They don’t seek you. For I have wounded you with the wound of an enemy, with the chastisement of a cruel one, for the greatness of your iniquity, because your sins were increased.

title: Jeremiah 30:15
content: 15 Why do you cry over your injury? Your pain is incurable. For the greatness of your iniquity, because your sins have increased, I have done these things to you.

title: Jeremiah 30:16
content: 16 Therefore all those who devour you will be devoured. All your adversaries, everyone of them, will go into captivity. Those who plunder you will be plunder. I will make all who prey on you become prey.

title: Jeremiah 30:17
content: 17 For I will restore health to you, and I will heal you of your wounds,” says the LORD, “because they have called you an outcast, saying, ‘It is Zion, whom no man seeks after.’”

title: Jeremiah 30:18
content: 18 The LORD says: “Behold, I will reverse the captivity of Jacob’s tents, and have compassion on his dwelling places. The city will be built on its own hill, and the palace will be inhabited in its own place.

title: Jeremiah 30:19
content: 19 Thanksgiving will proceed out of them with the voice of those who make merry. I will multiply them, and they will not be few; I will also glorify them, and they will not be small.

title: Jeremiah 30:20
content: 20 Their children also will be as before, and their congregation will be established before me. I will punish all who oppress them.

title: Jeremiah 30:21
content: 21 Their prince will be one of them, and their ruler will proceed from among them. I will cause him to draw near, and he will approach me; for who is he who has had boldness to approach me?” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 30:22
content: 22 “You shall be my people, and I will be your God.

title: Jeremiah 30:23
content: 23 Behold, the LORD’s storm, his wrath, has gone out, a sweeping storm; it will burst on the head of the wicked.

title: Jeremiah 30:24
content: 24 The fierce anger of the LORD will not return until he has accomplished, and until he has performed the intentions of his heart. In the latter days you will understand it.”

title: Jeremiah 31:1
content: 1 “At that time,” says the LORD, “I will be the God of all the families of Israel, and they will be my people.”

title: Jeremiah 31:2
content: 2 The LORD says, “The people who survive the sword found favor in the wilderness; even Israel, when I went to cause him to rest.”

title: Jeremiah 31:3
content: 3 The LORD appeared of old to me, saying, “Yes, I have loved you with an everlasting love. Therefore I have drawn you with loving kindness.

title: Jeremiah 31:4
content: 4 I will build you again, and you will be built, O virgin of Israel. You will again be adorned with your tambourines, and will go out in the dances of those who make merry.

title: Jeremiah 31:5
content: 5 Again you will plant vineyards on the mountains of Samaria. The planters will plant, and will enjoy its fruit.

title: Jeremiah 31:6
content: 6 For there will be a day that the watchmen on the hills of Ephraim cry, ‘Arise! Let’s go up to Zion to the LORD our God.’”

title: Jeremiah 31:7
content: 7 For the LORD says, “Sing with gladness for Jacob, and shout for the chief of the nations. Publish, praise, and say, ‘LORD, save your people, the remnant of Israel!’

title: Jeremiah 31:8
content: 8 Behold, I will bring them from the north country, and gather them from the uttermost parts of the earth, along with the blind and the lame, the woman with child and her who travails with child together. They will return as a great company.

title: Jeremiah 31:9
content: 9 They will come with weeping. I will lead them with petitions. I will cause them to walk by rivers of waters, in a straight way in which they won’t stumble; for I am a father to Israel. Ephraim is my firstborn.

title: Jeremiah 31:10
content: 10 “Hear the LORD’s word, you nations, and declare it in the distant islands. Say, ‘He who scattered Israel will gather him, and keep him, as a shepherd does his flock.’

title: Jeremiah 31:11
content: 11 For the LORD has ransomed Jacob, and redeemed him from the hand of him who was stronger than he.

title: Jeremiah 31:12
content: 12 They will come and sing in the height of Zion, and will flow to the goodness of the LORD, to the grain, to the new wine, to the oil, and to the young of the flock and of the herd. Their soul will be as a watered garden. They will not sorrow any more at all.

title: Jeremiah 31:13
content: 13 Then the virgin will rejoice in the dance, the young men and the old together; for I will turn their mourning into joy, and will comfort them, and make them rejoice from their sorrow.

title: Jeremiah 31:14
content: 14 I will satiate the soul of the priests with fatness, and my people will be satisfied with my goodness,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 31:15
content: 15 The LORD says: “A voice is heard in Ramah, lamentation and bitter weeping, Rachel weeping for her children. She refuses to be comforted for her children, because they are no more.”

title: Jeremiah 31:16
content: 16 The LORD says: “Refrain your voice from weeping, and your eyes from tears, for your work will be rewarded,” says the LORD. “They will come again from the land of the enemy.

title: Jeremiah 31:17
content: 17 There is hope for your latter end,” says the LORD. “Your children will come again to their own territory.

title: Jeremiah 31:18
content: 18 “I have surely heard Ephraim grieving thus, ‘You have chastised me, and I was chastised, as an untrained calf. Turn me, and I will be turned, for you are the LORD my God.

title: Jeremiah 31:19
content: 19 Surely after that I was turned. I repented. After that I was instructed. I struck my thigh. I was ashamed, yes, even confounded, because I bore the reproach of my youth.’

title: Jeremiah 31:20
content: 20 Is Ephraim my dear son? Is he a darling child? For as often as I speak against him, I still earnestly remember him. Therefore my heart yearns for him. I will surely have mercy on him,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 31:21
content: 21 “Set up road signs. Make guideposts. Set your heart toward the highway, even the way by which you went. Turn again, virgin of Israel. Turn again to these your cities.

title: Jeremiah 31:22
content: 22 How long will you go here and there, you backsliding daughter? For the LORD has created a new thing in the earth: a woman will encompass a man.”

title: Jeremiah 31:23
content: 23 The LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says: “Yet again they will use this speech in the land of Judah and in its cities, when I reverse their captivity: ‘The LORD bless you, habitation of righteousness, mountain of holiness.’

title: Jeremiah 31:24
content: 24 Judah and all its cities will dwell therein together, the farmers, and those who go about with flocks.

title: Jeremiah 31:25
content: 25 For I have satiated the weary soul, and I have replenished every sorrowful soul.”

title: Jeremiah 31:26
content: 26 On this I awakened, and saw; and my sleep was sweet to me.

title: Jeremiah 31:27
content: 27 “Behold, the days come,” says the LORD, “that I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man and with the seed of animal.

title: Jeremiah 31:28
content: 28 It will happen that, like as I have watched over them to pluck up and to break down and to overthrow and to destroy and to afflict, so I will watch over them to build and to plant,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 31:29
content: 29 “In those days they will say no more, “‘The fathers have eaten sour grapes, and the children’s teeth are set on edge.’

title: Jeremiah 31:30
content: 30 But everyone will die for his own iniquity. Every man who eats the sour grapes, his teeth will be set on edge.

title: Jeremiah 31:31
content: 31 “Behold, the days come,” says the LORD, “that I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel, and with the house of Judah,

title: Jeremiah 31:32
content: 32 not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day that I took them by the hand to bring them out of the land of Egypt, which covenant of mine they broke, although I was a husband to them,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 31:33
content: 33 “But this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days,” says the LORD: “I will put my law in their inward parts, and I will write it in their heart. I will be their God, and they shall be my people.

title: Jeremiah 31:34
content: 34 They will no longer each teach his neighbor, and every man teach his brother, saying, ‘Know the LORD;’ for they will all know me, from their least to their greatest,” says the LORD, “for I will forgive their iniquity, and I will remember their sin no more.”

title: Jeremiah 31:35
content: 35 The LORD, who gives the sun for a light by day, and the ordinances of the moon and of the stars for a light by night, who stirs up the sea, so that its waves roar— the LORD of Armies is his name, says:

title: Jeremiah 31:36
content: 36 “If these ordinances depart from before me,” says the LORD, “then the offspring of Israel also will cease from being a nation before me forever.”

title: Jeremiah 31:37
content: 37 The LORD says: “If heaven above can be measured, and the foundations of the earth searched out beneath, then I will also cast off all the offspring of Israel for all that they have done,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 31:38
content: 38 “Behold, the days come,” says the LORD, “that the city will be built to the LORD from the tower of Hananel to the gate of the corner.

title: Jeremiah 31:39
content: 39 The measuring line will go out further straight onward to the hill Gareb, and will turn toward Goah.

title: Jeremiah 31:40
content: 40 The whole valley of the dead bodies and of the ashes, and all the fields to the brook Kidron, to the corner of the horse gate toward the east, will be holy to the LORD. It will not be plucked up or thrown down any more forever.”

title: Jeremiah 32:1
content: 1 This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar.

title: Jeremiah 32:2
content: 2 Now at that time the king of Babylon’s army was besieging Jerusalem. Jeremiah the prophet was shut up in the court of the guard, which was in the king of Judah’s house.

title: Jeremiah 32:3
content: 3 For Zedekiah king of Judah had shut him up, saying, “Why do you prophesy, and say, ‘The LORD says, “Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will take it;

title: Jeremiah 32:4
content: 4 and Zedekiah king of Judah won’t escape out of the hand of the Chaldeans, but will surely be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon, and will speak with him mouth to mouth, and his eyes will see his eyes;

title: Jeremiah 32:5
content: 5 and he will bring Zedekiah to Babylon, and he will be there until I visit him,” says the LORD, “though you fight with the Chaldeans, you will not prosper”’?”

title: Jeremiah 32:6
content: 6 Jeremiah said, “The LORD’s word came to me, saying,

title: Jeremiah 32:7
content: 7 ‘Behold, Hanamel the son of Shallum your uncle will come to you, saying, “Buy my field that is in Anathoth; for the right of redemption is yours to buy it.”’”

title: Jeremiah 32:8
content: 8 “So Hanamel my uncle’s son came to me in the court of the guard according to the LORD’s word, and said to me, ‘Please buy my field that is in Anathoth, which is in the land of Benjamin; for the right of inheritance is yours, and the redemption is yours. Buy it for yourself.’ “Then I knew that this was the LORD’s word.

title: Jeremiah 32:9
content: 9 I bought the field that was in Anathoth of Hanamel my uncle’s son, and weighed him the money, even seventeen shekels of silver.

title: Jeremiah 32:10
content: 10 I signed the deed, sealed it, called witnesses, and weighed the money in the balances to him.

title: Jeremiah 32:11
content: 11 So I took the deed of the purchase, both that which was sealed, containing the terms and conditions, and that which was open;

title: Jeremiah 32:12
content: 12 and I delivered the deed of the purchase to Baruch the son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, in the presence of Hanamel my uncle’s son, and in the presence of the witnesses who signed the deed of the purchase, before all the Jews who sat in the court of the guard.

title: Jeremiah 32:13
content: 13 “I commanded Baruch before them, saying,

title: Jeremiah 32:14
content: 14 the LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘Take these deeds, this deed of the purchase which is sealed, and this deed which is open, and put them in an earthen vessel, that they may last many days.’

title: Jeremiah 32:15
content: 15 For the LORD of Armies, the God of Israel says: ‘Houses and fields and vineyards will yet again be bought in this land.’

title: Jeremiah 32:16
content: 16 Now after I had delivered the deed of the purchase to Baruch the son of Neriah, I prayed to the LORD, saying,

title: Jeremiah 32:17
content: 17 “Ah Lord GOD! Behold, you have made the heavens and the earth by your great power and by your outstretched arm. There is nothing too hard for you.

title: Jeremiah 32:18
content: 18 You show loving kindness to thousands, and repay the iniquity of the fathers into the bosom of their children after them. The great, the mighty God, the LORD of Armies is your name:

title: Jeremiah 32:19
content: 19 great in counsel, and mighty in work; whose eyes are open to all the ways of the children of men, to give everyone according to his ways, and according to the fruit of his doings;

title: Jeremiah 32:20
content: 20 who performed signs and wonders in the land of Egypt, even to this day, both in Israel and among other men; and made yourself a name, as it is today;

title: Jeremiah 32:21
content: 21 and brought your people Israel out of the land of Egypt with signs, with wonders, with a strong hand, with an outstretched arm, and with great terror;

title: Jeremiah 32:22
content: 22 and gave them this land, which you swore to their fathers to give them, a land flowing with milk and honey.

title: Jeremiah 32:23
content: 23 They came in and possessed it, but they didn’t obey your voice and didn’t walk in your law. They have done nothing of all that you commanded them to do. Therefore you have caused all this evil to come upon them.

title: Jeremiah 32:24
content: 24 “Behold, siege ramps have been built against the city to take it. The city is given into the hand of the Chaldeans who fight against it, because of the sword, of the famine, and of the pestilence. What you have spoken has happened. Behold, you see it.

title: Jeremiah 32:25
content: 25 You have said to me, Lord GOD, ‘Buy the field for money, and call witnesses;’ whereas the city is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.”

title: Jeremiah 32:26
content: 26 Then the LORD’s word came to Jeremiah, saying,

title: Jeremiah 32:27
content: 27 “Behold, I am the LORD, the God of all flesh. Is there anything too hard for me?

title: Jeremiah 32:28
content: 28 Therefore the LORD says: Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the Chaldeans, and into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he will take it.

title: Jeremiah 32:29
content: 29 The Chaldeans, who fight against this city, will come and set this city on fire, and burn it with the houses on whose roofs they have offered incense to Baal, and poured out drink offerings to other gods, to provoke me to anger.

title: Jeremiah 32:30
content: 30 “For the children of Israel and the children of Judah have done only that which was evil in my sight from their youth; for the children of Israel have only provoked me to anger with the work of their hands, says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 32:31
content: 31 For this city has been to me a provocation of my anger and of my wrath from the day that they built it even to this day, so that I should remove it from before my face,

title: Jeremiah 32:32
content: 32 because of all the evil of the children of Israel and of the children of Judah, which they have done to provoke me to anger—they, their kings, their princes, their priests, their prophets, the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

title: Jeremiah 32:33
content: 33 They have turned their backs to me, and not their faces. Although I taught them, rising up early and teaching them, yet they have not listened to receive instruction.

title: Jeremiah 32:34
content: 34 But they set their abominations in the house which is called by my name, to defile it.

title: Jeremiah 32:35
content: 35 They built the high places of Baal, which are in the valley of the son of Hinnom, to cause their sons and their daughters to pass through fire to Molech, which I didn’t command them. It didn’t even come into my mind, that they should do this abomination, to cause Judah to sin.”

title: Jeremiah 32:36
content: 36 Now therefore the LORD, the God of Israel, says concerning this city, about which you say, “It is given into the hand of the king of Babylon by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence:”

title: Jeremiah 32:37
content: 37 “Behold, I will gather them out of all the countries where I have driven them in my anger, and in my wrath, and in great indignation; and I will bring them again to this place. I will cause them to dwell safely.

title: Jeremiah 32:38
content: 38 Then they will be my people, and I will be their God.

title: Jeremiah 32:39
content: 39 I will give them one heart and one way, that they may fear me forever, for their good and the good of their children after them.

title: Jeremiah 32:40
content: 40 I will make an everlasting covenant with them, that I will not turn away from following them, to do them good. I will put my fear in their hearts, that they may not depart from me.

title: Jeremiah 32:41
content: 41 Yes, I will rejoice over them to do them good, and I will plant them in this land assuredly with my whole heart and with my whole soul.”

title: Jeremiah 32:42
content: 42 For the LORD says: “Just as I have brought all this great evil on this people, so I will bring on them all the good that I have promised them.

title: Jeremiah 32:43
content: 43 Fields will be bought in this land, about which you say, ‘It is desolate, without man or animal. It is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.’

title: Jeremiah 32:44
content: 44 Men will buy fields for money, sign the deeds, seal them, and call witnesses, in the land of Benjamin, and in the places around Jerusalem, in the cities of Judah, in the cities of the hill country, in the cities of the lowland, and in the cities of the South; for I will cause their captivity to be reversed,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 33:1
content: 1 Moreover the LORD’s word came to Jeremiah the second time, while he was still locked up in the court of the guard, saying,

title: Jeremiah 33:2
content: 2 “The LORD who does it, the LORD who forms it to establish it—the LORD is his name, says:

title: Jeremiah 33:3
content: 3 ‘Call to me, and I will answer you, and will show you great and difficult things, which you don’t know.’

title: Jeremiah 33:4
content: 4 For the LORD, the God of Israel, says concerning the houses of this city and concerning the houses of the kings of Judah, which are broken down to make a defense against the mounds and against the sword:

title: Jeremiah 33:5
content: 5 ‘While men come to fight with the Chaldeans, and to fill them with the dead bodies of men, whom I have killed in my anger and in my wrath, and for all whose wickedness I have hidden my face from this city,

title: Jeremiah 33:6
content: 6 behold, I will bring it health and healing, and I will cure them; and I will reveal to them abundance of peace and truth.

title: Jeremiah 33:7
content: 7 I will restore the fortunes of Judah and Israel, and will build them as at the first.

title: Jeremiah 33:8
content: 8 I will cleanse them from all their iniquity by which they have sinned against me. I will pardon all their iniquities by which they have sinned against me and by which they have transgressed against me.

title: Jeremiah 33:9
content: 9 This city will be to me for a name of joy, for praise, and for glory, before all the nations of the earth, which will hear all the good that I do to them, and will fear and tremble for all the good and for all the peace that I provide to it.’”

title: Jeremiah 33:10
content: 10 The LORD says: “Yet again there will be heard in this place, about which you say, ‘It is waste, without man and without animal, even in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, that are desolate, without man and without inhabitant and without animal,’

title: Jeremiah 33:11
content: 11 the voice of joy and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the voice of those who say, ‘Give thanks to the LORD of Armies, for the LORD is good, for his loving kindness endures forever;’ who bring thanksgiving into the LORD’s house. For I will cause the captivity of the land to be reversed as at the first,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 33:12
content: 12 The LORD of Armies says: “Yet again there will be in this place, which is waste, without man and without animal, and in all its cities, a habitation of shepherds causing their flocks to lie down.

title: Jeremiah 33:13
content: 13 In the cities of the hill country, in the cities of the lowland, in the cities of the South, in the land of Benjamin, in the places around Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah, the flocks will again pass under the hands of him who counts them,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 33:14
