content: 14 “Behold, the days come,” says the LORD, “that I will perform that good word which I have spoken concerning the house of Israel and concerning the house of Judah.

title: Jeremiah 33:15
content: 15 “In those days and at that time, I will cause a Branch of righteousness to grow up to David. He will execute justice and righteousness in the land.

title: Jeremiah 33:16
content: 16 In those days Judah will be saved, and Jerusalem will dwell safely. This is the name by which she will be called: The LORD our righteousness.”

title: Jeremiah 33:17
content: 17 For the LORD says: “David will never lack a man to sit on the throne of the house of Israel.

title: Jeremiah 33:18
content: 18 The Levitical priests won’t lack a man before me to offer burnt offerings, to burn meal offerings, and to do sacrifice continually.”

title: Jeremiah 33:19
content: 19 The LORD’s word came to Jeremiah, saying,

title: Jeremiah 33:20
content: 20 “The LORD says: ‘If you can break my covenant of the day and my covenant of the night, so that there will not be day and night in their time,

title: Jeremiah 33:21
content: 21 then my covenant could also be broken with David my servant, that he won’t have a son to reign on his throne; and with the Levitical priests, my ministers.

title: Jeremiah 33:22
content: 22 As the army of the sky can’t be counted, and the sand of the sea can’t be measured, so I will multiply the offspring of David my servant and the Levites who minister to me.’”

title: Jeremiah 33:23
content: 23 The LORD’s word came to Jeremiah, saying,

title: Jeremiah 33:24
content: 24 “Don’t consider what this people has spoken, saying, ‘Has the LORD cast off the two families which he chose?’ Thus they despise my people, that they should be no more a nation before them.”

title: Jeremiah 33:25
content: 25 The LORD says: “If my covenant of day and night fails, if I have not appointed the ordinances of heaven and earth,

title: Jeremiah 33:26
content: 26 then I will also cast away the offspring of Jacob, and of David my servant, so that I will not take of his offspring to be rulers over the offspring of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; for I will cause their captivity to be reversed and will have mercy on them.”

title: Jeremiah 34:1
content: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD, when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, with all his army, all the kingdoms of the earth that were under his dominion, and all the peoples, were fighting against Jerusalem and against all its cities, saying:

title: Jeremiah 34:2
content: 2 “The LORD, the God of Israel, says, ‘Go, and speak to Zedekiah king of Judah, and tell him, the LORD says, “Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon and he will burn it with fire.

title: Jeremiah 34:3
content: 3 You won’t escape out of his hand, but will surely be taken and delivered into his hand. Your eyes will see the eyes of the king of Babylon, and he will speak with you mouth to mouth. You will go to Babylon.”’

title: Jeremiah 34:4
content: 4 “Yet hear the LORD’s word, O Zedekiah king of Judah. The LORD says concerning you, ‘You won’t die by the sword.

title: Jeremiah 34:5
content: 5 You will die in peace; and with the burnings of your fathers, the former kings who were before you, so they will make a burning for you. They will lament you, saying, “Ah Lord!” for I have spoken the word,’ says the LORD.”

title: Jeremiah 34:6
content: 6 Then Jeremiah the prophet spoke all these words to Zedekiah king of Judah in Jerusalem,

title: Jeremiah 34:7
content: 7 when the king of Babylon’s army was fighting against Jerusalem and against all the cities of Judah that were left, against Lachish and against Azekah; for these alone remained of the cities of Judah as fortified cities.

title: Jeremiah 34:8
content: 8 The word came to Jeremiah from the LORD, after King Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people who were at Jerusalem, to proclaim liberty to them,

title: Jeremiah 34:9
content: 9 that every man should let his male servant, and every man his female servant, who is a Hebrew or a Hebrewess, go free, that no one should make bondservants of them, of a Jew his brother.

title: Jeremiah 34:10
content: 10 All the princes and all the people obeyed who had entered into the covenant, that everyone should let his male servant and everyone his female servant go free, that no one should make bondservants of them any more. They obeyed and let them go,

title: Jeremiah 34:11
content: 11 but afterwards they turned, and caused the servants and the handmaids whom they had let go free to return, and brought them into subjection for servants and for handmaids.

title: Jeremiah 34:12
content: 12 Therefore the LORD’s word came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,

title: Jeremiah 34:13
content: 13 “The LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘I made a covenant with your fathers in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage, saying:

title: Jeremiah 34:14
content: 14 At the end of seven years, every man of you shall release his brother who is a Hebrew, who has been sold to you, and has served you six years. You shall let him go free from you. But your fathers didn’t listen to me, and didn’t incline their ear.

title: Jeremiah 34:15
content: 15 You had now turned, and had done that which is right in my eyes, in every man proclaiming liberty to his neighbor. You had made a covenant before me in the house which is called by my name;

title: Jeremiah 34:16
content: 16 but you turned and profaned my name, and every man caused his servant and every man his handmaid, whom you had let go free at their pleasure, to return. You brought them into subjection, to be to you for servants and for handmaids.’”

title: Jeremiah 34:17
content: 17 Therefore the LORD says: “You have not listened to me, to proclaim liberty, every man to his brother, and every man to his neighbor. Behold, I proclaim to you a liberty,” says the LORD, “to the sword, to the pestilence, and to the famine. I will make you be tossed back and forth among all the kingdoms of the earth.

title: Jeremiah 34:18
content: 18 I will give the men who have transgressed my covenant, who have not performed the words of the covenant which they made before me when they cut the calf in two and passed between its parts:

title: Jeremiah 34:19
content: 19 the princes of Judah, the princes of Jerusalem, the eunuchs, the priests, and all the people of the land, who passed between the parts of the calf.

title: Jeremiah 34:20
content: 20 I will even give them into the hand of their enemies and into the hand of those who seek their life. Their dead bodies will be food for the birds of the sky and for the animals of the earth.

title: Jeremiah 34:21
content: 21 “I will give Zedekiah king of Judah and his princes into the hands of their enemies, into the hands of those who seek their life and into the hands of the king of Babylon’s army, who has gone away from you.

title: Jeremiah 34:22
content: 22 Behold, I will command,” says the LORD, “and cause them to return to this city. They will fight against it, take it, and burn it with fire. I will make the cities of Judah a desolation, without inhabitant.”

title: Jeremiah 35:1
content: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying,

title: Jeremiah 35:2
content: 2 “Go to the house of the Rechabites, and speak to them, and bring them into the LORD’s house, into one of the rooms, and give them wine to drink.”

title: Jeremiah 35:3
content: 3 Then I took Jaazaniah the son of Jeremiah, the son of Habazziniah, with his brothers, all his sons, and the whole house of the Rechabites;

title: Jeremiah 35:4
content: 4 and I brought them into the LORD’s house, into the room of the sons of Hanan the son of Igdaliah, the man of God, which was by the room of the princes, which was above the room of Maaseiah the son of Shallum, the keeper of the threshold.

title: Jeremiah 35:5
content: 5 I set before the sons of the house of the Rechabites bowls full of wine, and cups; and I said to them, “Drink wine!”

title: Jeremiah 35:6
content: 6 But they said, “We will drink no wine; for Jonadab the son of Rechab, our father, commanded us, saying, ‘You shall drink no wine, neither you nor your children, forever.

title: Jeremiah 35:7
content: 7 You shall not build a house, sow seed, plant a vineyard, or have any; but all your days you shall dwell in tents, that you may live many days in the land in which you live as nomads.’

title: Jeremiah 35:8
content: 8 We have obeyed the voice of Jonadab the son of Rechab, our father, in all that he commanded us, to drink no wine all our days, we, our wives, our sons, or our daughters;

title: Jeremiah 35:9
content: 9 and not to build houses for ourselves to dwell in. We have no vineyard, field, or seed;

title: Jeremiah 35:10
content: 10 but we have lived in tents, and have obeyed, and done according to all that Jonadab our father commanded us.

title: Jeremiah 35:11
content: 11 But when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up into the land, we said, ‘Come! Let’s go to Jerusalem for fear of the army of the Chaldeans, and for fear of the army of the Syrians; so we will dwell at Jerusalem.’”

title: Jeremiah 35:12
content: 12 Then the LORD’s word came to Jeremiah, saying,

title: Jeremiah 35:13
content: 13 “The LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘Go and tell the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, “Will you not receive instruction to listen to my words?” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 35:14
content: 14 “The words of Jonadab the son of Rechab that he commanded his sons, not to drink wine, are performed; and to this day they drink none, for they obey their father’s commandment; but I have spoken to you, rising up early and speaking, and you have not listened to me.

title: Jeremiah 35:15
content: 15 I have sent also to you all my servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them, saying, ‘Every one of you must return now from his evil way, amend your doings, and don’t go after other gods to serve them. Then you will dwell in the land which I have given to you and to your fathers;’ but you have not inclined your ear, nor listened to me.

title: Jeremiah 35:16
content: 16 The sons of Jonadab the son of Rechab have performed the commandment of their father which he commanded them, but this people has not listened to me.”’

title: Jeremiah 35:17
content: 17 “Therefore the LORD, the God of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘Behold, I will bring on Judah and on all the inhabitants of Jerusalem all the evil that I have pronounced against them, because I have spoken to them, but they have not heard; and I have called to them, but they have not answered.’”

title: Jeremiah 35:18
content: 18 Jeremiah said to the house of the Rechabites, “The LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘Because you have obeyed the commandment of Jonadab your father, and kept all his precepts, and done according to all that he commanded you,’

title: Jeremiah 35:19
content: 19 therefore the LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘Jonadab the son of Rechab will not lack a man to stand before me forever.’”

title: Jeremiah 36:1
content: 1 In the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,

title: Jeremiah 36:2
content: 2 “Take a scroll of a book, and write in it all the words that I have spoken to you against Israel, against Judah, and against all the nations, from the day I spoke to you, from the days of Josiah even to this day.

title: Jeremiah 36:3
content: 3 It may be that the house of Judah will hear all the evil which I intend to do to them, that they may each return from his evil way; that I may forgive their iniquity and their sin.”

title: Jeremiah 36:4
content: 4 Then Jeremiah called Baruch the son of Neriah; and Baruch wrote from the mouth of Jeremiah all the LORD’s words, which he had spoken to him, on a scroll of a book.

title: Jeremiah 36:5
content: 5 Jeremiah commanded Baruch, saying, “I am restricted. I can’t go into the LORD’s house.

title: Jeremiah 36:6
content: 6 Therefore you go, and read from the scroll which you have written from my mouth, the LORD’s words, in the ears of the people in the LORD’s house on the fast day. Also you shall read them in the ears of all Judah who come out of their cities.

title: Jeremiah 36:7
content: 7 It may be they will present their supplication before the LORD, and will each return from his evil way; for the LORD has pronounced great anger and wrath against this people.”

title: Jeremiah 36:8
content: 8 Baruch the son of Neriah did according to all that Jeremiah the prophet commanded him, reading in the book the LORD’s words in the LORD’s house.

title: Jeremiah 36:9
content: 9 Now in the fifth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, in the ninth month, all the people in Jerusalem and all the people who came from the cities of Judah to Jerusalem, proclaimed a fast before the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 36:10
content: 10 Then Baruch read the words of Jeremiah from the book in the LORD’s house, in the room of Gemariah the son of Shaphan the scribe, in the upper court, at the entry of the new gate of the LORD’s house, in the ears of all the people.

title: Jeremiah 36:11
content: 11 When Micaiah the son of Gemariah, the son of Shaphan, had heard out of the book all the LORD’s words,

title: Jeremiah 36:12
content: 12 he went down into the king’s house, into the scribe’s room; and behold, all the princes were sitting there, Elishama the scribe, Delaiah the son of Shemaiah, Elnathan the son of Achbor, Gemariah the son of Shaphan, Zedekiah the son of Hananiah, and all the princes.

title: Jeremiah 36:13
content: 13 Then Micaiah declared to them all the words that he had heard, when Baruch read the book in the ears of the people.

title: Jeremiah 36:14
content: 14 Therefore all the princes sent Jehudi the son of Nethaniah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Cushi, to Baruch, saying, “Take in your hand the scroll in which you have read in the ears of the people, and come.” So Baruch the son of Neriah took the scroll in his hand, and came to them.

title: Jeremiah 36:15
content: 15 They said to him, “Sit down now, and read it in our hearing.” So Baruch read it in their hearing.

title: Jeremiah 36:16
content: 16 Now when they had heard all the words, they turned in fear one toward another, and said to Baruch, “We will surely tell the king of all these words.”

title: Jeremiah 36:17
content: 17 They asked Baruch, saying, “Tell us now, how did you write all these words at his mouth?”

title: Jeremiah 36:18
content: 18 Then Baruch answered them, “He dictated all these words to me with his mouth, and I wrote them with ink in the book.”

title: Jeremiah 36:19
content: 19 Then the princes said to Baruch, “You and Jeremiah go hide. Don’t let anyone know where you are.”

title: Jeremiah 36:20
content: 20 They went in to the king into the court, but they had laid up the scroll in the room of Elishama the scribe. Then they told all the words in the hearing of the king.

title: Jeremiah 36:21
content: 21 So the king sent Jehudi to get the scroll, and he took it out of the room of Elishama the scribe. Jehudi read it in the hearing of the king, and in the hearing of all the princes who stood beside the king.

title: Jeremiah 36:22
content: 22 Now the king was sitting in the winter house in the ninth month, and there was a fire in the brazier burning before him.

title: Jeremiah 36:23
content: 23 When Jehudi had read three or four columns, the king cut it with the penknife, and cast it into the fire that was in the brazier, until all the scroll was consumed in the fire that was in the brazier.

title: Jeremiah 36:24
content: 24 The king and his servants who heard all these words were not afraid, and didn’t tear their garments.

title: Jeremiah 36:25
content: 25 Moreover Elnathan and Delaiah and Gemariah had made intercession to the king that he would not burn the scroll; but he would not listen to them.

title: Jeremiah 36:26
content: 26 The king commanded Jerahmeel the king’s son, and Seraiah the son of Azriel, and Shelemiah the son of Abdeel, to arrest Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet; but the LORD hid them.

title: Jeremiah 36:27
content: 27 Then the LORD’s word came to Jeremiah, after the king had burned the scroll, and the words which Baruch wrote at the mouth of Jeremiah, saying,

title: Jeremiah 36:28
content: 28 “Take again another scroll, and write in it all the former words that were in the first scroll, which Jehoiakim the king of Judah has burned.

title: Jeremiah 36:29
content: 29 Concerning Jehoiakim king of Judah you shall say, ‘The LORD says: “You have burned this scroll, saying, ‘Why have you written therein, saying, “The king of Babylon will certainly come and destroy this land, and will cause to cease from there man and animal”?’”

title: Jeremiah 36:30
content: 30 Therefore the LORD says concerning Jehoiakim king of Judah: “He will have no one to sit on David’s throne. His dead body will be cast out in the day to the heat, and in the night to the frost.

title: Jeremiah 36:31
content: 31 I will punish him, his offspring, and his servants for their iniquity. I will bring on them, on the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and on the men of Judah, all the evil that I have pronounced against them, but they didn’t listen.”’”

title: Jeremiah 36:32
content: 32 Then Jeremiah took another scroll, and gave it to Baruch the scribe, the son of Neriah, who wrote therein from the mouth of Jeremiah all the words of the book which Jehoiakim king of Judah had burned in the fire; and many similar words were added to them.

title: Jeremiah 37:1
content: 1 Zedekiah the son of Josiah reigned as king instead of Coniah the son of Jehoiakim, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon made king in the land of Judah.

title: Jeremiah 37:2
content: 2 But neither he, nor his servants, nor the people of the land, listened to the LORD’s words, which he spoke by the prophet Jeremiah.

title: Jeremiah 37:3
content: 3 Zedekiah the king sent Jehucal the son of Shelemiah and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, to the prophet Jeremiah, saying, “Pray now to the LORD our God for us.”

title: Jeremiah 37:4
content: 4 Now Jeremiah came in and went out among the people, for they had not put him into prison.

title: Jeremiah 37:5
content: 5 Pharaoh’s army had come out of Egypt; and when the Chaldeans who were besieging Jerusalem heard news of them, they withdrew from Jerusalem.

title: Jeremiah 37:6
content: 6 Then the LORD’s word came to the prophet Jeremiah, saying,

title: Jeremiah 37:7
content: 7 “The LORD, the God of Israel, says, ‘You shall tell the king of Judah, who sent you to me to inquire of me: “Behold, Pharaoh’s army, which has come out to help you, will return to Egypt into their own land.

title: Jeremiah 37:8
content: 8 The Chaldeans will come again, and fight against this city. They will take it and burn it with fire.”’

title: Jeremiah 37:9
content: 9 “The LORD says, ‘Don’t deceive yourselves, saying, “The Chaldeans will surely depart from us;” for they will not depart.

title: Jeremiah 37:10
content: 10 For though you had struck the whole army of the Chaldeans who fight against you, and only wounded men remained among them, they would each rise up in his tent and burn this city with fire.’”

title: Jeremiah 37:11
content: 11 When the army of the Chaldeans had withdrawn from Jerusalem for fear of Pharaoh’s army,

title: Jeremiah 37:12
content: 12 then Jeremiah went out of Jerusalem to go into the land of Benjamin, to receive his portion there, in the middle of the people.

title: Jeremiah 37:13
content: 13 When he was in Benjamin’s gate, a captain of the guard was there, whose name was Irijah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Hananiah; and he seized Jeremiah the prophet, saying, “You are defecting to the Chaldeans!”

title: Jeremiah 37:14
content: 14 Then Jeremiah said, “That is false! I am not defecting to the Chaldeans.” But he didn’t listen to him; so Irijah seized Jeremiah, and brought him to the princes.

title: Jeremiah 37:15
content: 15 The princes were angry with Jeremiah, and struck him, and put him in prison in the house of Jonathan the scribe; for they had made that the prison.

title: Jeremiah 37:16
content: 16 When Jeremiah had come into the dungeon house and into the cells, and Jeremiah had remained there many days,

title: Jeremiah 37:17
content: 17 then Zedekiah the king sent and had him brought out. The king asked him secretly in his house, “Is there any word from the LORD?” Jeremiah said, “There is.” He also said, “You will be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon.”

title: Jeremiah 37:18
content: 18 Moreover Jeremiah said to King Zedekiah, “How have I sinned against you, against your servants, or against this people, that you have put me in prison?

title: Jeremiah 37:19
content: 19 Now where are your prophets who prophesied to you, saying, ‘The king of Babylon will not come against you, nor against this land’?

title: Jeremiah 37:20
content: 20 Now please hear, my lord the king: please let my supplication be presented before you, that you not cause me to return to the house of Jonathan the scribe, lest I die there.”

title: Jeremiah 37:21
content: 21 Then Zedekiah the king commanded, and they committed Jeremiah into the court of the guard. They gave him daily a loaf of bread out of the bakers’ street, until all the bread in the city was gone. Thus Jeremiah remained in the court of the guard.

title: Jeremiah 38:1
content: 1 Shephatiah the son of Mattan, Gedaliah the son of Pashhur, Jucal the son of Shelemiah, and Pashhur the son of Malchijah heard the words that Jeremiah spoke to all the people, saying,

title: Jeremiah 38:2
content: 2 “The LORD says, ‘He who remains in this city will die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, but he who goes out to the Chaldeans will live. He will escape with his life and he will live.’

title: Jeremiah 38:3
content: 3 The LORD says, ‘This city will surely be given into the hand of the army of the king of Babylon, and he will take it.’”

title: Jeremiah 38:4
content: 4 Then the princes said to the king, “Please let this man be put to death, because he weakens the hands of the men of war who remain in this city, and the hands of all the people, in speaking such words to them; for this man doesn’t seek the welfare of this people, but harm.”

title: Jeremiah 38:5
content: 5 Zedekiah the king said, “Behold, he is in your hand; for the king can’t do anything to oppose you.”

title: Jeremiah 38:6
content: 6 Then they took Jeremiah and threw him into the dungeon of Malchijah the king’s son, that was in the court of the guard. They let down Jeremiah with cords. In the dungeon there was no water, but mire; and Jeremiah sank in the mire.

title: Jeremiah 38:7
content: 7 Now when Ebedmelech the Ethiopian, a eunuch, who was in the king’s house, heard that they had put Jeremiah in the dungeon (the king was then sitting in Benjamin’s gate),

title: Jeremiah 38:8
content: 8 Ebedmelech went out of the king’s house, and spoke to the king, saying,

title: Jeremiah 38:9
content: 9 “My lord the king, these men have done evil in all that they have done to Jeremiah the prophet, whom they have cast into the dungeon. He is likely to die in the place where he is, because of the famine; for there is no more bread in the city.”

title: Jeremiah 38:10
content: 10 Then the king commanded Ebedmelech the Ethiopian, saying, “Take from here thirty men with you, and take up Jeremiah the prophet out of the dungeon, before he dies.”

title: Jeremiah 38:11
content: 11 So Ebedmelech took the men with him, and went into the house of the king under the treasury, and took from there rags and worn-out garments, and let them down by cords into the dungeon to Jeremiah.

title: Jeremiah 38:12
content: 12 Ebedmelech the Ethiopian said to Jeremiah, “Now put these rags and worn-out garments under your armpits under the cords.” Jeremiah did so.

title: Jeremiah 38:13
content: 13 So they lifted Jeremiah up with the cords, and took him up out of the dungeon; and Jeremiah remained in the court of the guard.

title: Jeremiah 38:14
content: 14 Then Zedekiah the king sent and took Jeremiah the prophet to himself into the third entry that is in the LORD’s house. Then the king said to Jeremiah, “I will ask you something. Hide nothing from me.”

title: Jeremiah 38:15
content: 15 Then Jeremiah said to Zedekiah, “If I declare it to you, will you not surely put me to death? If I give you counsel, you will not listen to me.”

title: Jeremiah 38:16
content: 16 So Zedekiah the king swore secretly to Jeremiah, saying, “As the LORD lives, who made our souls, I will not put you to death, neither will I give you into the hand of these men who seek your life.”

title: Jeremiah 38:17
content: 17 Then Jeremiah said to Zedekiah, “The LORD, the God of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘If you will go out to the king of Babylon’s princes, then your soul will live, and this city will not be burned with fire. You will live, along with your house.

title: Jeremiah 38:18
content: 18 But if you will not go out to the king of Babylon’s princes, then this city will be given into the hand of the Chaldeans, and they will burn it with fire, and you won’t escape out of their hand.’”

title: Jeremiah 38:19
content: 19 Zedekiah the king said to Jeremiah, “I am afraid of the Jews who have defected to the Chaldeans, lest they deliver me into their hand, and they mock me.”

title: Jeremiah 38:20
content: 20 But Jeremiah said, “They won’t deliver you. Obey, I beg you, the LORD’s voice, in that which I speak to you; so it will be well with you, and your soul will live.

title: Jeremiah 38:21
content: 21 But if you refuse to go out, this is the word that the LORD has shown me:

title: Jeremiah 38:22
content: 22 ‘Behold, all the women who are left in the king of Judah’s house will be brought out to the king of Babylon’s princes, and those women will say, “Your familiar friends have turned on you, and have prevailed over you. Your feet are sunk in the mire, they have turned away from you.”

title: Jeremiah 38:23
content: 23 They will bring out all your wives and your children to the Chaldeans. You won’t escape out of their hand, but will be taken by the hand of the king of Babylon. You will cause this city to be burned with fire.’”

title: Jeremiah 38:24
content: 24 Then Zedekiah said to Jeremiah, “Let no man know of these words, and you won’t die.

title: Jeremiah 38:25
content: 25 But if the princes hear that I have talked with you, and they come to you, and tell you, ‘Declare to us now what you have said to the king; don’t hide it from us, and we will not put you to death; also tell us what the king said to you;’

title: Jeremiah 38:26
content: 26 then you shall tell them, ‘I presented my supplication before the king, that he would not cause me to return to Jonathan’s house, to die there.’”

title: Jeremiah 38:27
content: 27 Then all the princes came to Jeremiah, and asked him; and he told them according to all these words that the king had commanded. So they stopped speaking with him, for the matter was not perceived.

title: Jeremiah 38:28
content: 28 So Jeremiah stayed in the court of the guard until the day that Jerusalem was taken.

title: Jeremiah 39:1
content: 1 In the ninth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and all his army came against Jerusalem, and besieged it.

title: Jeremiah 39:2
content: 2 In the eleventh year of Zedekiah, in the fourth month, the ninth day of the month, a breach was made in the city.

title: Jeremiah 39:3
content: 3 All the princes of the king of Babylon came in, and sat in the middle gate: Nergal Sharezer, Samgarnebo, Sarsechim the Rabsaris, Nergal Sharezer the Rabmag, with all the rest of the princes of the king of Babylon.

title: Jeremiah 39:4
content: 4 When Zedekiah the king of Judah and all the men of war saw them, then they fled and went out of the city by night, by the way of the king’s garden, through the gate between the two walls; and he went out toward the Arabah.

title: Jeremiah 39:5
content: 5 But the army of the Chaldeans pursued them, and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho. When they had taken him, they brought him up to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath; and he pronounced judgment on him.

title: Jeremiah 39:6
content: 6 Then the king of Babylon killed Zedekiah’s sons in Riblah before his eyes. The king of Babylon also killed all the nobles of Judah.

title: Jeremiah 39:7
content: 7 Moreover he put out Zedekiah’s eyes and bound him in fetters, to carry him to Babylon.

title: Jeremiah 39:8
content: 8 The Chaldeans burned the king’s house and the people’s houses with fire and broke down the walls of Jerusalem.

title: Jeremiah 39:9
content: 9 Then Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive into Babylon the rest of the people who remained in the city, the deserters also who fell away to him, and the rest of the people who remained.

title: Jeremiah 39:10
content: 10 But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left of the poor of the people, who had nothing, in the land of Judah, and gave them vineyards and fields at the same time.

title: Jeremiah 39:11
content: 11 Now Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon commanded Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard concerning Jeremiah, saying,

title: Jeremiah 39:12
content: 12 “Take him and take care of him. Do him no harm; but do to him even as he tells you.”

title: Jeremiah 39:13
content: 13 So Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, Nebushazban, Rabsaris, and Nergal Sharezer, Rabmag, and all the chief officers of the king of Babylon

title: Jeremiah 39:14
content: 14 sent and took Jeremiah out of the court of the guard, and committed him to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, that he should bring him home. So he lived among the people.

title: Jeremiah 39:15
content: 15 Now the LORD’s word came to Jeremiah while he was shut up in the court of the guard, saying,

title: Jeremiah 39:16
content: 16 “Go, and speak to Ebedmelech the Ethiopian, saying, ‘The LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says: “Behold, I will bring my words on this city for evil, and not for good; and they will be accomplished before you in that day.

title: Jeremiah 39:17
content: 17 But I will deliver you in that day,” says the LORD; “and you will not be given into the hand of the men of whom you are afraid.

title: Jeremiah 39:18
content: 18 For I will surely save you. You won’t fall by the sword, but you will escape with your life, because you have put your trust in me,” says the LORD.’”

title: Jeremiah 40:1
content: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah from the LORD, after Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had let him go from Ramah, when he had taken him being bound in chains among all the captives of Jerusalem and Judah who were carried away captive to Babylon.

title: Jeremiah 40:2
content: 2 The captain of the guard took Jeremiah and said to him, “The LORD your God pronounced this evil on this place;

title: Jeremiah 40:3
content: 3 and the LORD has brought it, and done according as he spoke. Because you have sinned against the LORD, and have not obeyed his voice, therefore this thing has come on you.

title: Jeremiah 40:4
content: 4 Now, behold, I release you today from the chains which are on your hand. If it seems good to you to come with me into Babylon, come, and I will take care of you; but if it seems bad to you to come with me into Babylon, don’t. Behold, all the land is before you. Where it seems good and right to you to go, go there.”

title: Jeremiah 40:5
content: 5 Now while he had not yet gone back, “Go back then,” he said, “to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, whom the king of Babylon has made governor over the cities of Judah, and dwell with him among the people; or go wherever it seems right to you to go.” So the captain of the guard gave him food and a present, and let him go.

title: Jeremiah 40:6
content: 6 Then Jeremiah went to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam to Mizpah, and lived with him among the people who were left in the land.

title: Jeremiah 40:7
content: 7 Now when all the captains of the forces who were in the fields, even they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah the son of Ahikam governor in the land, and had committed to him men, women, children, and of the poorest of the land, of those who were not carried away captive to Babylon,

title: Jeremiah 40:8
content: 8 then Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan and Jonathan the sons of Kareah, and Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth, and the sons of Ephai the Netophathite, and Jezaniah the son of the Maacathite, they and their men came to Gedaliah to Mizpah.

title: Jeremiah 40:9
content: 9 Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan swore to them and to their men, saying, “Don’t be afraid to serve the Chaldeans. Dwell in the land, and serve the king of Babylon, and it will be well with you.

title: Jeremiah 40:10
content: 10 As for me, behold, I will dwell at Mizpah, to stand before the Chaldeans who will come to us; but you, gather wine and summer fruits and oil, and put them in your vessels, and dwell in your cities that you have taken.”

title: Jeremiah 40:11
content: 11 Likewise when all the Jews who were in Moab, and among the children of Ammon, and in Edom, and who were in all the countries, heard that the king of Babylon had left a remnant of Judah, and that he had set over them Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan,

title: Jeremiah 40:12
content: 12 then all the Jews returned out of all places where they were driven, and came to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah, to Mizpah, and gathered very much wine and summer fruits.

title: Jeremiah 40:13
content: 13 Moreover Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces who were in the fields, came to Gedaliah to Mizpah,

title: Jeremiah 40:14
content: 14 and said to him, “Do you know that Baalis the king of the children of Ammon has sent Ishmael the son of Nethaniah to take your life?” But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam didn’t believe them.

title: Jeremiah 40:15
content: 15 Then Johanan the son of Kareah spoke to Gedaliah in Mizpah secretly, saying, “Please let me go, and I will kill Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and no man will know it. Why should he take your life, that all the Jews who are gathered to you should be scattered, and the remnant of Judah perish?”

title: Jeremiah 40:16
content: 16 But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam said to Johanan the son of Kareah, “You shall not do this thing, for you speak falsely of Ishmael.”

title: Jeremiah 41:1
content: 1 Now in the seventh month, Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the royal offspring and one of the chief officers of the king, and ten men with him, came to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam to Mizpah; and there they ate bread together in Mizpah.

title: Jeremiah 41:2
content: 2 Then Ishmael the son of Nethaniah arose, and the ten men who were with him, and struck Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan with the sword and killed him, whom the king of Babylon had made governor over the land.

title: Jeremiah 41:3
content: 3 Ishmael also killed all the Jews who were with Gedaliah at Mizpah, and the Chaldean men of war who were found there.

title: Jeremiah 41:4
content: 4 The second day after he had killed Gedaliah, and no man knew it,

title: Jeremiah 41:5
content: 5 men came from Shechem, from Shiloh, and from Samaria, even eighty men, having their beards shaved and their clothes torn, and having cut themselves, with meal offerings and frankincense in their hand, to bring them to the LORD’s house.

title: Jeremiah 41:6
content: 6 Ishmael the son of Nethaniah went out from Mizpah to meet them, weeping all along as he went, and as he met them, he said to them, “Come to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam.”

title: Jeremiah 41:7
content: 7 It was so, when they came into the middle of the city, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah killed them, and cast them into the middle of the pit, he, and the men who were with him.

title: Jeremiah 41:8
content: 8 But ten men were found among those who said to Ishmael, “Don’t kill us; for we have stores hidden in the field, of wheat, and of barley, and of oil, and of honey.” So he stopped, and didn’t kill them among their brothers.

title: Jeremiah 41:9
content: 9 Now the pit in which Ishmael cast all the dead bodies of the men whom he had killed, by the side of Gedaliah (this was that which Asa the king had made for fear of Baasha king of Israel), Ishmael the son of Nethaniah filled it with those who were killed.

title: Jeremiah 41:10
content: 10 Then Ishmael carried away captive all of the people who were left in Mizpah, even the king’s daughters, and all the people who remained in Mizpah, whom Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had committed to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam. Ishmael the son of Nethaniah carried them away captive, and departed to go over to the children of Ammon.

title: Jeremiah 41:11
content: 11 But when Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces who were with him, heard of all the evil that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had done,

title: Jeremiah 41:12
content: 12 then they took all the men, and went to fight with Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and found him by the great waters that are in Gibeon.

title: Jeremiah 41:13
content: 13 Now when all the people who were with Ishmael saw Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces who were with him, then they were glad.

title: Jeremiah 41:14
content: 14 So all the people who Ishmael had carried away captive from Mizpah turned about and came back, and went to Johanan the son of Kareah.

title: Jeremiah 41:15
content: 15 But Ishmael the son of Nethaniah escaped from Johanan with eight men, and went to the children of Ammon.

title: Jeremiah 41:16
content: 16 Then Johanan the son of Kareah and all the captains of the forces who were with him took all the remnant of the people whom he had recovered from Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, from Mizpah, after he had killed Gedaliah the son of Ahikam—the men of war, with the women, the children, and the eunuchs, whom he had brought back from Gibeon.

title: Jeremiah 41:17
content: 17 They departed and lived in Geruth Chimham, which is by Bethlehem, to go to enter into Egypt

title: Jeremiah 41:18
content: 18 because of the Chaldeans; for they were afraid of them, because Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had killed Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, whom the king of Babylon made governor over the land.

title: Jeremiah 42:1
content: 1 Then all the captains of the forces, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and Jezaniah the son of Hoshaiah, and all the people from the least even to the greatest, came near,

title: Jeremiah 42:2
content: 2 and said to Jeremiah the prophet, “Please let our supplication be presented before you, and pray for us to the LORD your God, even for all this remnant, for we are left but a few of many, as your eyes see us,

title: Jeremiah 42:3
content: 3 that the LORD your God may show us the way in which we should walk, and the things that we should do.”

title: Jeremiah 42:4
content: 4 Then Jeremiah the prophet said to them, “I have heard you. Behold, I will pray to the LORD your God according to your words; and it will happen that whatever thing the LORD answers you, I will declare it to you. I will keep nothing back from you.”

title: Jeremiah 42:5
content: 5 Then they said to Jeremiah, “May the LORD be a true and faithful witness among us, if we don’t do according to all the word with which the LORD your God sends you to tell us.

title: Jeremiah 42:6
content: 6 Whether it is good, or whether it is bad, we will obey the voice of the LORD our God, to whom we send you; that it may be well with us, when we obey the voice of the LORD our God.”

title: Jeremiah 42:7
content: 7 After ten days, the LORD’s word came to Jeremiah.

title: Jeremiah 42:8
content: 8 Then he called Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces who were with him, and all the people from the least even to the greatest,

title: Jeremiah 42:9
content: 9 and said to them, “The LORD, the God of Israel, to whom you sent me to present your supplication before him, says:

title: Jeremiah 42:10
content: 10 ‘If you will still live in this land, then I will build you, and not pull you down, and I will plant you, and not pluck you up; for I grieve over the distress that I have brought on you.

title: Jeremiah 42:11
content: 11 Don’t be afraid of the king of Babylon, of whom you are afraid. Don’t be afraid of him,’ says the LORD, ‘for I am with you to save you, and to deliver you from his hand.

title: Jeremiah 42:12
content: 12 I will grant you mercy, that he may have mercy on you, and cause you to return to your own land.

title: Jeremiah 42:13
content: 13 “‘But if you say, “We will not dwell in this land,” so that you don’t obey the LORD your God’s voice,

title: Jeremiah 42:14
content: 14 saying, “No, but we will go into the land of Egypt, where we will see no war, nor hear the sound of the trumpet, nor have hunger of bread; and there we will dwell;”’

title: Jeremiah 42:15
content: 15 now therefore hear the LORD’s word, O remnant of Judah! The LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says, ‘If you indeed set your faces to enter into Egypt, and go to live there,

title: Jeremiah 42:16
content: 16 then it will happen that the sword, which you fear, will overtake you there in the land of Egypt; and the famine, about which you are afraid, will follow close behind you there in Egypt; and you will die there.

title: Jeremiah 42:17
content: 17 So will it be with all the men who set their faces to go into Egypt to live there. They will die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence. None of them will remain or escape from the evil that I will bring on them.’

title: Jeremiah 42:18
content: 18 For the LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘As my anger and my wrath has been poured out on the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so my wrath will be poured out on you, when you enter into Egypt; and you will be an object of horror, an astonishment, a curse, and a reproach; and you will see this place no more.’

title: Jeremiah 42:19
content: 19 “The LORD has spoken concerning you, remnant of Judah, ‘Don’t go into Egypt!’ Know certainly that I have testified to you today.

title: Jeremiah 42:20
content: 20 For you have dealt deceitfully against your own souls; for you sent me to the LORD your God, saying, ‘Pray for us to the LORD our God; and according to all that the LORD our God says, so declare to us, and we will do it.’

title: Jeremiah 42:21
content: 21 I have declared it to you today; but you have not obeyed the LORD your God’s voice in anything for which he has sent me to you.

title: Jeremiah 42:22
content: 22 Now therefore know certainly that you will die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence in the place where you desire to go to live.”

title: Jeremiah 43:1
content: 1 When Jeremiah had finished speaking to all the people all the words of the LORD their God, with which the LORD their God had sent him to them, even all these words,

title: Jeremiah 43:2
content: 2 then Azariah the son of Hoshaiah, Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the proud men spoke, saying to Jeremiah, “You speak falsely. The LORD our God has not sent you to say, ‘You shall not go into Egypt to live there;’

title: Jeremiah 43:3
content: 3 but Baruch the son of Neriah has turned you against us, to deliver us into the hand of the Chaldeans, that they may put us to death or carry us away captive to Babylon.”

title: Jeremiah 43:4
content: 4 So Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces, and all the people, didn’t obey the LORD’s voice, to dwell in the land of Judah.

title: Jeremiah 43:5
content: 5 But Johanan the son of Kareah and all the captains of the forces took all the remnant of Judah, who had returned from all the nations where they had been driven, to live in the land of Judah—

title: Jeremiah 43:6
content: 6 the men, the women, the children, the king’s daughters, and every person who Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had left with Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan; and Jeremiah the prophet, and Baruch the son of Neriah.

title: Jeremiah 43:7
content: 7 They came into the land of Egypt, for they didn’t obey the LORD’s voice; and they came to Tahpanhes.

title: Jeremiah 43:8
content: 8 Then the LORD’s word came to Jeremiah in Tahpanhes, saying,

title: Jeremiah 43:9
content: 9 “Take great stones in your hand and hide them in mortar in the brick work which is at the entry of Pharaoh’s house in Tahpanhes, in the sight of the men of Judah.

title: Jeremiah 43:10
content: 10 Tell them, the LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘Behold, I will send and take Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, my servant, and will set his throne on these stones that I have hidden; and he will spread his royal pavilion over them.

title: Jeremiah 43:11
content: 11 He will come, and will strike the land of Egypt; such as are for death will be put to death, and such as are for captivity to captivity, and such as are for the sword to the sword.

title: Jeremiah 43:12
content: 12 I will kindle a fire in the houses of the gods of Egypt. He will burn them, and carry them away captive. He will array himself with the land of Egypt, as a shepherd puts on his garment; and he will go out from there in peace.

title: Jeremiah 43:13
content: 13 He will also break the pillars of Beth Shemesh that is in the land of Egypt; and he will burn the houses of the gods of Egypt with fire.’”

title: Jeremiah 44:1
content: 1 The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the Jews who lived in the land of Egypt, who lived at Migdol, and at Tahpanhes, and at Memphis, and in the country of Pathros, saying,

title: Jeremiah 44:2
content: 2 “The LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘You have seen all the evil that I have brought on Jerusalem, and on all the cities of Judah. Behold, today they are a desolation, and no man dwells in them,

title: Jeremiah 44:3
content: 3 because of their wickedness which they have committed to provoke me to anger, in that they went to burn incense, to serve other gods that they didn’t know, neither they, nor you, nor your fathers.

title: Jeremiah 44:4
content: 4 However I sent to you all my servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them, saying, “Oh, don’t do this abominable thing that I hate.”

title: Jeremiah 44:5
content: 5 But they didn’t listen and didn’t incline their ear. They didn’t turn from their wickedness, to stop burning incense to other gods.

title: Jeremiah 44:6
content: 6 Therefore my wrath and my anger was poured out, and was kindled in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem; and they are wasted and desolate, as it is today.’

title: Jeremiah 44:7
content: 7 “Therefore now the LORD, the God of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘Why do you commit great evil against your own souls, to cut off from yourselves man and woman, infant and nursing child out of the middle of Judah, to leave yourselves no one remaining,

title: Jeremiah 44:8
content: 8 in that you provoke me to anger with the works of your hands, burning incense to other gods in the land of Egypt where you have gone to live, that you may be cut off, and that you may be a curse and a reproach among all the nations of the earth?

title: Jeremiah 44:9
content: 9 Have you forgotten the wickedness of your fathers, the wickedness of the kings of Judah, the wickedness of their wives, your own wickedness, and the wickedness of your wives which they committed in the land of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?

title: Jeremiah 44:10
content: 10 They are not humbled even to this day, neither have they feared, nor walked in my law, nor in my statutes, that I set before you and before your fathers.’

title: Jeremiah 44:11
content: 11 “Therefore the LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says: ‘Behold, I will set my face against you for evil, even to cut off all Judah.

title: Jeremiah 44:12
content: 12 I will take the remnant of Judah that have set their faces to go into the land of Egypt to live there, and they will all be consumed. They will fall in the land of Egypt. They will be consumed by the sword and by the famine. They will die, from the least even to the greatest, by the sword and by the famine. They will be an object of horror, an astonishment, a curse, and a reproach.

title: Jeremiah 44:13
content: 13 For I will punish those who dwell in the land of Egypt, as I have punished Jerusalem, by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence;

title: Jeremiah 44:14
content: 14 so that none of the remnant of Judah, who have gone into the land of Egypt to live there, will escape or be left to return into the land of Judah, to which they have a desire to return to dwell there; for no one will return except those who will escape.’”

title: Jeremiah 44:15
content: 15 Then all the men who knew that their wives burned incense to other gods, and all the women who stood by, a great assembly, even all the people who lived in the land of Egypt, in Pathros, answered Jeremiah, saying,

title: Jeremiah 44:16
content: 16 “As for the word that you have spoken to us in the LORD’s name, we will not listen to you.

title: Jeremiah 44:17
content: 17 But we will certainly perform every word that has gone out of our mouth, to burn incense to the queen of the sky and to pour out drink offerings to her, as we have done, we and our fathers, our kings and our princes, in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem; for then we had plenty of food, and were well, and saw no evil.

title: Jeremiah 44:18
content: 18 But since we stopped burning incense to the queen of the sky, and pouring out drink offerings to her, we have lacked all things, and have been consumed by the sword and by the famine.”

title: Jeremiah 44:19
content: 19 The women said, “When we burned incense to the queen of the sky and poured out drink offerings to her, did we make her cakes to worship her, and pour out drink offerings to her, without our husbands?”

title: Jeremiah 44:20
content: 20 Then Jeremiah said to all the people—to the men and to the women, even to all the people who had given him an answer, saying,

title: Jeremiah 44:21
content: 21 “The incense that you burned in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, you and your fathers, your kings and your princes, and the people of the land, didn’t the LORD remember them, and didn’t it come into his mind?

title: Jeremiah 44:22
content: 22 Thus the LORD could no longer bear it, because of the evil of your doings and because of the abominations which you have committed. Therefore your land has become a desolation, an astonishment, and a curse, without inhabitant, as it is today.

title: Jeremiah 44:23
content: 23 Because you have burned incense and because you have sinned against the LORD, and have not obeyed the LORD’s voice, nor walked in his law, nor in his statutes, nor in his testimonies; therefore this evil has happened to you, as it is today.”

title: Jeremiah 44:24
content: 24 Moreover Jeremiah said to all the people, including all the women, “Hear the LORD’s word, all Judah who are in the land of Egypt!

title: Jeremiah 44:25
content: 25 The LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says, ‘You and your wives have both spoken with your mouths, and with your hands have fulfilled it, saying, “We will surely perform our vows that we have vowed, to burn incense to the queen of the sky, and to pour out drink offerings to her.” “‘Establish then your vows, and perform your vows.’

title: Jeremiah 44:26
content: 26 “Therefore hear the LORD’s word, all Judah who dwell in the land of Egypt: ‘Behold, I have sworn by my great name,’ says the LORD, ‘that my name will no more be named in the mouth of any man of Judah in all the land of Egypt, saying, “As the Lord GOD lives.”

title: Jeremiah 44:27
content: 27 Behold, I watch over them for evil, and not for good; and all the men of Judah who are in the land of Egypt will be consumed by the sword and by the famine, until they are all gone.

title: Jeremiah 44:28
content: 28 Those who escape the sword will return out of the land of Egypt into the land of Judah few in number. All the remnant of Judah, who have gone into the land of Egypt to live there, will know whose word will stand, mine or theirs.

title: Jeremiah 44:29
content: 29 “‘This will be the sign to you,’ says the LORD, ‘that I will punish you in this place, that you may know that my words will surely stand against you for evil.’

title: Jeremiah 44:30
content: 30 The LORD says, ‘Behold, I will give Pharaoh Hophra king of Egypt into the hand of his enemies and into the hand of those who seek his life, just as I gave Zedekiah king of Judah into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, who was his enemy and sought his life.’”

title: Jeremiah 45:1
content: 1 The message that Jeremiah the prophet spoke to Baruch the son of Neriah, when he wrote these words in a book at the mouth of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying,

title: Jeremiah 45:2
content: 2 “The LORD, the God of Israel, says to you, Baruch:

title: Jeremiah 45:3
content: 3 ‘You said, “Woe is me now! For the LORD has added sorrow to my pain! I am weary with my groaning, and I find no rest.”’

title: Jeremiah 45:4
content: 4 “You shall tell him, the LORD says: ‘Behold, that which I have built, I will break down, and that which I have planted I will pluck up; and this in the whole land.

title: Jeremiah 45:5
content: 5 Do you seek great things for yourself? Don’t seek them; for, behold, I will bring evil on all flesh,’ says the LORD, ‘but I will let you escape with your life wherever you go.’”

title: Jeremiah 46:1
content: 1 The LORD’s word which came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations.

title: Jeremiah 46:2
content: 2 Of Egypt: concerning the army of Pharaoh Necoh king of Egypt, which was by the river Euphrates in Carchemish, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon struck in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah.

title: Jeremiah 46:3
content: 3 “Prepare the buckler and shield, and draw near to battle!

title: Jeremiah 46:4
content: 4 Harness the horses, and get up, you horsemen, and stand up with your helmets. Polish the spears, put on the coats of mail.

title: Jeremiah 46:5
content: 5 Why have I seen it? They are dismayed and are turned backward. Their mighty ones are beaten down, have fled in haste, and don’t look back. Terror is on every side,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 46:6
content: 6 “Don’t let the swift flee away, nor the mighty man escape. In the north by the river Euphrates they have stumbled and fallen.

title: Jeremiah 46:7
content: 7 “Who is this who rises up like the Nile, like rivers whose waters surge?

title: Jeremiah 46:8
content: 8 Egypt rises up like the Nile, like rivers whose waters surge. He says, ‘I will rise up. I will cover the earth. I will destroy cities and its inhabitants.’

title: Jeremiah 46:9
content: 9 Go up, you horses! Rage, you chariots! Let the mighty men go out: Cush and Put, who handle the shield; and the Ludim, who handle and bend the bow.

title: Jeremiah 46:10
content: 10 For that day is of the Lord, GOD of Armies, a day of vengeance, that he may avenge himself of his adversaries. The sword will devour and be satiated, and will drink its fill of their blood; for the Lord, GOD of Armies, has a sacrifice in the north country by the river Euphrates.

title: Jeremiah 46:11
content: 11 Go up into Gilead, and take balm, virgin daughter of Egypt. You use many medicines in vain. There is no healing for you.

title: Jeremiah 46:12
content: 12 The nations have heard of your shame, and the earth is full of your cry; for the mighty man has stumbled against the mighty, they both fall together.”

title: Jeremiah 46:13
content: 13 The word that the LORD spoke to Jeremiah the prophet, how that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon should come and strike the land of Egypt:

title: Jeremiah 46:14
content: 14 “Declare in Egypt, publish in Migdol, and publish in Memphis and in Tahpanhes; say, ‘Stand up, and prepare, for the sword has devoured around you.’

title: Jeremiah 46:15
content: 15 Why are your strong ones swept away? They didn’t stand, because the LORD pushed them.

title: Jeremiah 46:16
content: 16 He made many to stumble. Yes, they fell on one another. They said, ‘Arise! Let’s go again to our own people, and to the land of our birth, from the oppressing sword.’

title: Jeremiah 46:17
content: 17 They cried there, ‘Pharaoh king of Egypt is but a noise; he has let the appointed time pass by.’

title: Jeremiah 46:18
content: 18 “As I live,” says the King, whose name is the LORD of Armies, “surely like Tabor among the mountains, and like Carmel by the sea, so he will come.

title: Jeremiah 46:19
content: 19 You daughter who dwells in Egypt, furnish yourself to go into captivity; for Memphis will become a desolation, and will be burned up, without inhabitant.

title: Jeremiah 46:20
content: 20 “Egypt is a very beautiful heifer; but destruction out of the north has come. It has come.

title: Jeremiah 46:21
content: 21 Also her hired men in the middle of her are like calves of the stall, for they also are turned back. They have fled away together. They didn’t stand, for the day of their calamity has come on them, the time of their visitation.

title: Jeremiah 46:22
content: 22 Its sound will go like the serpent, for they will march with an army, and come against her with axes, as wood cutters.

title: Jeremiah 46:23
content: 23 They will cut down her forest,” says the LORD, “though it can’t be searched; because they are more than the locusts, and are innumerable.

title: Jeremiah 46:24
content: 24 The daughter of Egypt will be disappointed; she will be delivered into the hand of the people of the north.”

title: Jeremiah 46:25
content: 25 The LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says: “Behold, I will punish Amon of No, and Pharaoh, and Egypt, with her gods and her kings, even Pharaoh, and those who trust in him.

title: Jeremiah 46:26
content: 26 I will deliver them into the hand of those who seek their lives, and into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of his servants. Afterwards it will be inhabited, as in the days of old,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 46:27
content: 27 “But don’t you be afraid, Jacob my servant. Don’t be dismayed, Israel; for, behold, I will save you from afar, and your offspring from the land of their captivity. Jacob will return, and will be quiet and at ease. No one will make him afraid.

title: Jeremiah 46:28
content: 28 Don’t be afraid, O Jacob my servant,” says the LORD, “for I am with you; for I will make a full end of all the nations where I have driven you, but I will not make a full end of you, but I will correct you in measure, and will in no way leave you unpunished.”

title: Jeremiah 47:1
content: 1 The LORD’s word that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the Philistines, before Pharaoh struck Gaza.

title: Jeremiah 47:2
content: 2 The LORD says: “Behold, waters rise up out of the north, and will become an overflowing stream, and will overflow the land and all that is therein, the city and those who dwell therein. The men will cry, and all the inhabitants of the land will wail.

title: Jeremiah 47:3
content: 3 At the noise of the stamping of the hoofs of his strong ones, at the rushing of his chariots, at the rumbling of his wheels, the fathers don’t look back for their children because their hands are so feeble,

title: Jeremiah 47:4
content: 4 because of the day that comes to destroy all the Philistines, to cut off from Tyre and Sidon every helper who remains; for the LORD will destroy the Philistines, the remnant of the isle of Caphtor.

title: Jeremiah 47:5
content: 5 Baldness has come on Gaza; Ashkelon is brought to nothing. You remnant of their valley, how long will you cut yourself?

title: Jeremiah 47:6
content: 6 “‘You sword of the LORD, how long will it be before you are quiet? Put yourself back into your scabbard; rest, and be still.’

title: Jeremiah 47:7
content: 7 “How can you be quiet, since the LORD has given you a command? Against Ashkelon, and against the seashore, there he has appointed it.”

title: Jeremiah 48:1
content: 1 Of Moab. The LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says: “Woe to Nebo! For it is laid waste. Kiriathaim is disappointed. It is taken. Misgab is put to shame and broken down.

title: Jeremiah 48:2
content: 2 The praise of Moab is no more. In Heshbon they have devised evil against her: ‘Come! Let’s cut her off from being a nation.’ You also, Madmen, will be brought to silence. The sword will pursue you.

title: Jeremiah 48:3
content: 3 The sound of a cry from Horonaim, desolation and great destruction!

title: Jeremiah 48:4
content: 4 Moab is destroyed. Her little ones have caused a cry to be heard.

title: Jeremiah 48:5
content: 5 For they will go up by the ascent of Luhith with continual weeping. For at the descent of Horonaim they have heard the distress of the cry of destruction.

title: Jeremiah 48:6
content: 6 Flee! Save your lives! Be like the juniper bush in the wilderness.

title: Jeremiah 48:7
content: 7 For, because you have trusted in your works and in your treasures, you also will be taken. Chemosh will go out into captivity, his priests and his princes together.

title: Jeremiah 48:8
content: 8 The destroyer will come on every city, and no city will escape; the valley also will perish, and the plain will be destroyed, as the LORD has spoken.

title: Jeremiah 48:9
content: 9 Give wings to Moab, that she may fly and get herself away: and her cities will become a desolation, without anyone to dwell in them.

title: Jeremiah 48:10
content: 10 “Cursed is he who does the work of the LORD negligently; and cursed is he who keeps back his sword from blood.

title: Jeremiah 48:11
content: 11 “Moab has been at ease from his youth, and he has settled on his dregs, and has not been emptied from vessel to vessel, neither has he gone into captivity; therefore his taste remains in him, and his scent is not changed.

title: Jeremiah 48:12
content: 12 Therefore behold, the days come,” says the LORD, “that I will send to him those who pour off, and they will pour him off; and they will empty his vessels, and break their containers in pieces.

title: Jeremiah 48:13
content: 13 Moab will be ashamed of Chemosh, as the house of Israel was ashamed of Bethel, their confidence.

title: Jeremiah 48:14
content: 14 “How do you say, ‘We are mighty men, and valiant men for the war’?

title: Jeremiah 48:15
content: 15 Moab is laid waste, and they have gone up into his cities, and his chosen young men have gone down to the slaughter,” says the King, whose name is the LORD of Armies.

title: Jeremiah 48:16
content: 16 “The calamity of Moab is near to come, and his affliction hurries fast.

title: Jeremiah 48:17
content: 17 All you who are around him, bemoan him; and all you who know his name, say, ‘How the strong staff is broken, the beautiful rod!’

title: Jeremiah 48:18
content: 18 “You daughter who dwells in Dibon, come down from your glory, and sit in thirst; for the destroyer of Moab has come up against you. He has destroyed your strongholds.

title: Jeremiah 48:19
content: 19 Inhabitant of Aroer, stand by the way and watch. Ask him who flees, and her who escapes; say, ‘What has been done?’

title: Jeremiah 48:20
content: 20 Moab is disappointed; for it is broken down. Wail and cry! Tell it by the Arnon, that Moab is laid waste.

title: Jeremiah 48:21
content: 21 Judgment has come on the plain country— on Holon, on Jahzah, on Mephaath,

title: Jeremiah 48:22
content: 22 on Dibon, on Nebo, on Beth Diblathaim,

title: Jeremiah 48:23
content: 23 on Kiriathaim, on Beth Gamul, on Beth Meon,

title: Jeremiah 48:24
content: 24 on Kerioth, on Bozrah, and on all the cities of the land of Moab, far or near.

title: Jeremiah 48:25
content: 25 The horn of Moab is cut off, and his arm is broken,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 48:26
content: 26 “Make him drunk, for he magnified himself against the LORD. Moab will wallow in his vomit, and he also will be in derision.

title: Jeremiah 48:27
content: 27 For wasn’t Israel a derision to you? Was he found among thieves? For as often as you speak of him, you shake your head.

title: Jeremiah 48:28
content: 28 You inhabitants of Moab, leave the cities, and dwell in the rock. Be like the dove that makes her nest over the mouth of the abyss.

title: Jeremiah 48:29
content: 29 “We have heard of the pride of Moab. He is very proud in his loftiness, his pride, his arrogance, and the arrogance of his heart.

title: Jeremiah 48:30
content: 30 I know his wrath,” says the LORD, “that it is nothing; his boastings have done nothing.

title: Jeremiah 48:31
content: 31 Therefore I will wail for Moab. Yes, I will cry out for all Moab. They will mourn for the men of Kir Heres.

title: Jeremiah 48:32
content: 32 With more than the weeping of Jazer I will weep for you, vine of Sibmah. Your branches passed over the sea. They reached even to the sea of Jazer. The destroyer has fallen on your summer fruits and on your vintage.

title: Jeremiah 48:33
content: 33 Gladness and joy is taken away from the fruitful field and from the land of Moab. I have caused wine to cease from the wine presses. No one will tread with shouting. The shouting will be no shouting.

title: Jeremiah 48:34
content: 34 From the cry of Heshbon even to Elealeh, even to Jahaz they have uttered their voice, from Zoar even to Horonaim, to Eglath Shelishiyah; for the waters of Nimrim will also become desolate.

title: Jeremiah 48:35
content: 35 Moreover I will cause to cease in Moab,” says the LORD, “him who offers in the high place, and him who burns incense to his gods.

title: Jeremiah 48:36
content: 36 Therefore my heart sounds for Moab like flutes, and my heart sounds like flutes for the men of Kir Heres. Therefore the abundance that he has gotten has perished.

title: Jeremiah 48:37
content: 37 For every head is bald, and every beard clipped. There are cuttings on all the hands, and sackcloth on the waist.

title: Jeremiah 48:38
content: 38 On all the housetops of Moab, and in its streets, there is lamentation everywhere; for I have broken Moab like a vessel in which no one delights,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 48:39
content: 39 “How it is broken down! How they wail! How Moab has turned the back with shame! So will Moab become a derision and a terror to all who are around him.”

title: Jeremiah 48:40
content: 40 For the LORD says: “Behold, he will fly as an eagle, and will spread out his wings against Moab.

title: Jeremiah 48:41
content: 41 Kerioth is taken, and the strongholds are seized. The heart of the mighty men of Moab at that day will be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.

title: Jeremiah 48:42
content: 42 Moab will be destroyed from being a people, because he has magnified himself against the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 48:43
content: 43 Terror, the pit, and the snare are on you, inhabitant of Moab,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 48:44
content: 44 “He who flees from the terror will fall into the pit; and he who gets up out of the pit will be taken in the snare, for I will bring on him, even on Moab, the year of their visitation,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 48:45
content: 45 “Those who fled stand without strength under the shadow of Heshbon; for a fire has gone out of Heshbon, and a flame from the middle of Sihon, and has devoured the corner of Moab, and the crown of the head of the tumultuous ones.

title: Jeremiah 48:46
content: 46 Woe to you, O Moab! The people of Chemosh are undone; for your sons are taken away captive, and your daughters into captivity.

title: Jeremiah 48:47
content: 47 “Yet I will reverse the captivity of Moab in the latter days,” says the LORD. Thus far is the judgment of Moab.

title: Jeremiah 49:1
content: 1 Of the children of Ammon. The LORD says: “Has Israel no sons? Has he no heir? Why then does Malcam possess Gad, and his people dwell in its cities?

title: Jeremiah 49:2
content: 2 Therefore behold, the days come,” says the LORD, “that I will cause an alarm of war to be heard against Rabbah of the children of Ammon, and it will become a desolate heap, and her daughters will be burned with fire; then Israel will possess those who possessed him,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 49:3
content: 3 “Wail, Heshbon, for Ai is laid waste! Cry, you daughters of Rabbah! Clothe yourself in sackcloth. Lament, and run back and forth among the fences; for Malcam will go into captivity, his priests and his princes together.

title: Jeremiah 49:4
content: 4 Why do you boast in the valleys, your flowing valley, backsliding daughter? You trusted in her treasures, saying, ‘Who will come to me?’

title: Jeremiah 49:5
content: 5 Behold, I will bring a terror on you,” says the Lord, GOD of Armies, “from all who are around you. All of you will be driven completely out, and there will be no one to gather together the fugitives.

title: Jeremiah 49:6
content: 6 “But afterward I will reverse the captivity of the children of Ammon,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 49:7
content: 7 Of Edom, the LORD of Armies says: “Is wisdom no more in Teman? Has counsel perished from the prudent? Has their wisdom vanished?

title: Jeremiah 49:8
content: 8 Flee! Turn back! Dwell in the depths, inhabitants of Dedan; for I will bring the calamity of Esau on him when I visit him.

title: Jeremiah 49:9
content: 9 If grape gatherers came to you, would they not leave some gleaning grapes? If thieves came by night, wouldn’t they steal until they had enough?

title: Jeremiah 49:10
content: 10 But I have made Esau bare, I have uncovered his secret places, and he will not be able to hide himself. His offspring is destroyed, with his brothers and his neighbors; and he is no more.

title: Jeremiah 49:11
content: 11 Leave your fatherless children. I will preserve them alive. Let your widows trust in me.”

title: Jeremiah 49:12
content: 12 For the LORD says: “Behold, they to whom it didn’t pertain to drink of the cup will certainly drink; and are you he who will altogether go unpunished? You won’t go unpunished, but you will surely drink.

title: Jeremiah 49:13
content: 13 For I have sworn by myself,” says the LORD, “that Bozrah will become an astonishment, a reproach, a waste, and a curse. All its cities will be perpetual wastes.”

title: Jeremiah 49:14
content: 14 I have heard news from the LORD, and an ambassador is sent among the nations, saying, “Gather yourselves together! Come against her! Rise up to the battle!”

title: Jeremiah 49:15
content: 15 “For, behold, I have made you small among the nations, and despised among men.

title: Jeremiah 49:16
content: 16 As for your terror, the pride of your heart has deceived you, O you who dwell in the clefts of the rock, who hold the height of the hill, though you should make your nest as high as the eagle, I will bring you down from there,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 49:17
content: 17 “Edom will become an astonishment. Everyone who passes by it will be astonished, and will hiss at all its plagues.

title: Jeremiah 49:18
content: 18 As in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and its neighbor cities,” says the LORD, “no man will dwell there, neither will any son of man live therein.

title: Jeremiah 49:19
content: 19 “Behold, he will come up like a lion from the pride of the Jordan against the strong habitation; for I will suddenly make them run away from it, and whoever is chosen, I will appoint him over it. For who is like me? Who will appoint me a time? Who is the shepherd who will stand before me?”

title: Jeremiah 49:20
content: 20 Therefore hear the counsel of the LORD, that he has taken against Edom, and his purposes that he has purposed against the inhabitants of Teman: Surely they will drag them away, the little ones of the flock. Surely he will make their habitation desolate over them.

title: Jeremiah 49:21
content: 21 The earth trembles at the noise of their fall; there is a cry, the noise which is heard in the Red Sea.

title: Jeremiah 49:22
content: 22 Behold, he will come up and fly as the eagle, and spread out his wings against Bozrah. The heart of the mighty men of Edom at that day will be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.

title: Jeremiah 49:23
content: 23 Of Damascus: “Hamath and Arpad are confounded, for they have heard evil news. They have melted away. There is sorrow on the sea. It can’t be quiet.

title: Jeremiah 49:24
content: 24 Damascus has grown feeble, she turns herself to flee, and trembling has seized her. Anguish and sorrows have taken hold of her, as of a woman in travail.

title: Jeremiah 49:25
content: 25 How is the city of praise not forsaken, the city of my joy?

title: Jeremiah 49:26
content: 26 Therefore her young men will fall in her streets, and all the men of war will be brought to silence in that day,” says the LORD of Armies.

title: Jeremiah 49:27
content: 27 “I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus, and it will devour the palaces of Ben Hadad.”

title: Jeremiah 49:28
content: 28 Of Kedar, and of the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon struck, The LORD says: “Arise, go up to Kedar, and destroy the children of the east.

title: Jeremiah 49:29
content: 29 They will take their tents and their flocks. they will carry away for themselves their curtains, all their vessels, and their camels; and they will cry to them, ‘Terror on every side!’

title: Jeremiah 49:30
content: 30 Flee! Wander far off! Dwell in the depths, you inhabitants of Hazor,” says the LORD; “for Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has taken counsel against you, and has conceived a purpose against you.

title: Jeremiah 49:31
content: 31 Arise! Go up to a nation that is at ease, that dwells without care,” says the LORD; “that has neither gates nor bars, that dwells alone.

title: Jeremiah 49:32
content: 32 Their camels will be a booty, and the multitude of their livestock a plunder. I will scatter to all winds those who have the corners of their beards cut off; and I will bring their calamity from every side of them,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 49:33
content: 33 Hazor will be a dwelling place of jackals, a desolation forever. No man will dwell there, neither will any son of man live therein.”

title: Jeremiah 49:34
content: 34 The LORD’s word that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning Elam, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying,

title: Jeremiah 49:35
content: 35 “The LORD of Armies says: ‘Behold, I will break the bow of Elam, the chief of their might.

title: Jeremiah 49:36
content: 36 I will bring on Elam the four winds from the four quarters of the sky, and will scatter them toward all those winds. There will be no nation where the outcasts of Elam will not come.

title: Jeremiah 49:37
content: 37 I will cause Elam to be dismayed before their enemies, and before those who seek their life. I will bring evil on them, even my fierce anger,’ says the LORD; ‘and I will send the sword after them, until I have consumed them.

title: Jeremiah 49:38
content: 38 I will set my throne in Elam, and will destroy from there king and princes,’ says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 49:39
content: 39 ‘But it will happen in the latter days that I will reverse the captivity of Elam,’ says the LORD.”

title: Jeremiah 50:1
content: 1 The word that the LORD spoke concerning Babylon, concerning the land of the Chaldeans, by Jeremiah the prophet.

title: Jeremiah 50:2
content: 2 “Declare among the nations and publish, and set up a standard; publish, and don’t conceal; say, ‘Babylon has been taken, Bel is disappointed, Merodach is dismayed! Her images are disappointed. Her idols are dismayed.’

title: Jeremiah 50:3
content: 3 For a nation comes up out of the north against her, which will make her land desolate, and no one will dwell in it. They have fled. They are gone, both man and animal.

title: Jeremiah 50:4
content: 4 “In those days, and in that time,” says the LORD, “the children of Israel will come, they and the children of Judah together; they will go on their way weeping, and will seek the LORD their God.

title: Jeremiah 50:5
content: 5 They will inquire concerning Zion with their faces turned toward it, saying, ‘Come, and join yourselves to the LORD in an everlasting covenant that will not be forgotten.’

title: Jeremiah 50:6
content: 6 My people have been lost sheep. Their shepherds have caused them to go astray. They have turned them away on the mountains. They have gone from mountain to hill. They have forgotten their resting place.

title: Jeremiah 50:7
content: 7 All who found them have devoured them. Their adversaries said, ‘We are not guilty, because they have sinned against the LORD, the habitation of righteousness, even the LORD, the hope of their fathers.’

title: Jeremiah 50:8
content: 8 “Flee out of the middle of Babylon! Go out of the land of the Chaldeans, and be as the male goats before the flocks.

title: Jeremiah 50:9
content: 9 For, behold, I will stir up and cause to come up against Babylon a company of great nations from the north country; and they will set themselves in array against her. She will be taken from there. Their arrows will be as of an expert mighty man. None of them will return in vain.

title: Jeremiah 50:10
content: 10 Chaldea will be a prey. All who prey on her will be satisfied,” says the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 50:11
content: 11 “Because you are glad, because you rejoice, O you who plunder my heritage, because you are wanton as a heifer that treads out the grain, and neigh as strong horses,

title: Jeremiah 50:12
content: 12 your mother will be utterly disappointed. She who bore you will be confounded. Behold, she will be the least of the nations, a wilderness, a dry land, and a desert.

title: Jeremiah 50:13
content: 13 Because of the LORD’s wrath she won’t be inhabited, but she will be wholly desolate. Everyone who goes by Babylon will be astonished, and hiss at all her plagues.

title: Jeremiah 50:14
content: 14 Set yourselves in array against Babylon all around, all you who bend the bow; shoot at her. Spare no arrows, for she has sinned against the LORD.

title: Jeremiah 50:15
content: 15 Shout against her all around. She has submitted herself. Her bulwarks have fallen. Her walls have been thrown down, for it is the vengeance of the LORD. Take vengeance on her. As she has done, do to her.

title: Jeremiah 50:16
content: 16 Cut off the sower from Babylon, and him who handles the sickle in the time of harvest. For fear of the oppressing sword, they will each return to their own people, and they will each flee to their own land.

title: Jeremiah 50:17
content: 17 “Israel is a hunted sheep. The lions have driven him away. First, the king of Assyria devoured him, and now at last Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has broken his bones.”

title: Jeremiah 50:18
content: 18 Therefore the LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, says: “Behold, I will punish the king of Babylon and his land, as I have punished the king of Assyria.

title: Jeremiah 50:19
content: 19 I will bring Israel again to his pasture, and he will feed on Carmel and Bashan. His soul will be satisfied on the hills of Ephraim and in Gilead.

title: Jeremiah 50:20
content: 20 In those days, and in that time,” says the LORD, “the iniquity of Israel will be sought for, and there will be none, also the sins of Judah, and they won’t be found; for I will pardon them whom I leave as a remnant.

title: Jeremiah 50:21
